Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

MSX International Group is the leading global provider of outsourced business solutions for the automotive industry making business in more than 80 countries. MSXI’s deep industry expertise combined with advanced data analytics and custom software solutions improve the performance of automotive dealership networks by increasing revenue, reducing cost, and enhancing customer satisfaction.

Job Description

As Data Analyst the primary responsibility of this role will be manage and track requests related to lead management, IT reporting, and data analysis, acting as the key contact between different stakeholders, internal and externally.

Key Tasks


Manage and track requests made to external provider / system providers for Lead management, IT reporting topics, and data analysis.
Serve as a point of contact between the different stakeholders.
Coordinate the development and implementation of new solutions required by both the external and internal client with the provider.
Review lead numbers reflected in reporting platforms and ensure those figures accurately match reality.
Propose solutions to help correct errors in data reporting.
Participate in the development of solutions with AI functionalities, e.g., chatbots, knowledge database.


Qualifications


You possess a degree in a relevant field such as: IT, Computer Science, Information System, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Business Analytics or related fields.
Experience with Data & Integration.
Knowledge and experience about AI tools, predictions, statistics.
Experience with html.
You have a good level of English at least C1 is required.
You have strong interpersonal skills, you are open minded, you enjoy working in a Team environment and you possess excellent communication skills and excellent analytical skills.
You are proficient in MS Office365 applications.


Additional Information

MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

Title: Assistant Data Analyst & Performance Qualité H/F - STAGE
Description:
Poste

From the house of dream to the house of talents

« Quoi que vous fassiez - pour le travail ou le plaisir - faites-le avec passion ! Vivez avec passion... »* Christian Dior

Christian Dior fut le couturier du rêve. Dès la fondation de sa Maison en 1947, marquée par la révolution du New Look, il métamorphose ses songes en de merveilleuses créations. Son esprit visionnaire n’a eu de cesse de magnifier les femmes du monde entier, inspirant aujourd’hui et plus que jamais ses successeurs. « Le tissu est le seul véhicule de nos rêves (…). La mode, en somme, est issue d’un rêve, et le rêve, c’est une évasion », écrivait-il dans son ouvrage Je suis couturier. Au fil de ses collections, Monsieur Dior est devenu le démiurge du bonheur de ses muses.

Aujourd’hui, riche de cet héritage d’exception et d’une communauté de plus de 7 500 talents, notre Maison incarne plus que jamais la Maison des Talents pensé par Christian Dior. Dans plus de 40 pays, nous faisons rayonner notre savoir-faire, notre audace et notre excellence à travers la passion et la créativité de nos collaborateurs. Rejoignez-nous et créez votre avenir dans notre univers généreux, disruptif et ambitieux où nous grandissons dans l’excellence, le courage et l’optimisme.


Le Petit Dictionnaire de la Mode


Missions


Amélioration de la qualité des produits finis :
Participer activement à l'amélioration continue de la qualité des produits finis en fournissant aux équipes Qualité Production des informations pertinentes issues des retours clients et des analyses de stock Retail.
Réaliser des analyses approfondies des problèmes de qualité par zone géographique, en identifiant les typologies de produits et les types de défauts les plus fréquents.
Assurer le suivi rigoureux des plans d'actions mis en place par la production pour résoudre les problèmes de qualité identifiés.
Reporting Qualité et Assurance de la Donnée :
Être responsable de la production de reportings qualité précis et pertinents, en veillant à la qualité et à la fiabilité des données utilisées.
Mettre en place des mécanismes de contrôle et de validation des données pour garantir leur exactitude et leur cohérence.
Définition et Formalisation des Processus Qualité :
Définir, formaliser et maintenir à jour l'ensemble des processus de la Qualité centrale de la Maison Dior, en étroite collaboration avec les équipes industrielles Qualité, Marketing, Supply Chain, Logistique et régionales.
Formaliser et mettre à jour les processus d'inspection des produits finis en partenariat avec les différents départements qualité industriels.
Concevoir et mettre en œuvre des outils d'analyse des reportings de contrôle qualité pour faciliter l'identification des tendances et des problèmes potentiels.


Profil


Diplômé(e) d'une école d'ingénieur ou de commerce.
Qualités d’analyse et de synthèse.
Très à l’aise avec les tableaux Excel, TCD, Power BI, PowerPoint.
Bon niveau d'anglais, l'italien serait un plus.
Capacité à travailler en équipe et à collaborer avec différents départements.
Sens du détail et rigueur dans le suivi des plans d’actions.


Ce stage est à pourvoir à partir de Septembre 2025 pour une durée de 6 mois.

Encourageant l’inclusion et la diversité sous toutes ses formes, Christian Dior Couture s'est engagé depuis 2013 dans une démarche en faveur de l'emploi des personnes en situation de handicap, et de la valorisation de toutes les singularités
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Finsolutia intends to reinforce its Information Technology (IT) team with a Data Analyst (M/F).

We are looking for talented and self-motivated individuals for a broad and interesting role working as part of a team based in Lisbon.

Responsibilities


Design and develop Microsoft Power BI reports and Dashboards (Operational, Strategic & Analytical) including data set ingestion and transformation, Data Modeling, Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) using the appropriate report templates depicting status of key performance indicators (KPIs) and other important business metrics for an organization to make data driven decisions
Work with cross-functional teams to gather and document reporting requirements to meet business needs
Build data models, technical and functional documentation with business partners
Review and interpret ongoing business report requirements;
Writing optimized SQL queries for integration with other applications
Designing database tables and related objects;
Transition developed reports and dashboards to interactive/automated dashboards using Power BI
Use T-SQL to develop and implement procedures and functions;
Provide support as required to ensure the availability and optimal performance of developed reports and dashboards for both external and internal users
Design and implement technology best practices, guidelines and repeatable processes
Extract and analyze data using PowerQuery, PivotTables, MS Excel, Power BI and DAX.
Design, develop, update, and optimize Power BI dashboards, reports and scorecards to meet business requirements.


Hard Skills


Understanding of T-SQL programming (Microsoft SQL Server )
Knowledge of data modeling following the best practices
2+ years of experience in creating reports, dashboards using Power BI Desktop and Server and maintaining Power BI dashboards on servers.
Understanding of tuning of Power BI reports, data sets, and SQL to deliver maximum report performance.
Experience with ETL Processes Experience with Python and C# (nice to have)
Fluent in English


Soft Skills


Proactivity and constant technological evolution;
Team work and result oriented;
Good communication and interpersonal / facilitation skills.


We’d like to inform you that personal data collected here are exclusively destined to the management of the recruitment process in question and will be processed and storage by Finsolutia, SA, or another Group company, in accordance with Personal Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of 27 April 2016 during a period of 5 years, after which they will be definitively eliminated.

We Further Inform You That The Holder Will Have Free Access To Its Personal Data, And May Request Its Updating, Rectification Or Removal By Simply Sending The Request In Writing To

Bernardo Cabral

Data Protection Officer

dpo@finsolutia.com
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the job




For one of our clients - an independent, global leader in financial risk management and technology solutions - we are seeking a Data Analyst to join their growing team.




In this role, you will:

Develop data products using a variety of tools that empower end users to perform self-service data analysis, providing rich and interactive data experiences.
Continuously enhance and optimize existing data products to ensure high quality and performance for end users.
Collaborate with product owners to efficiently translate business requirements into actionable features within data products.
Support the Product Management team in designing visual wireframes for new data products to be developed internally.
Use SQL or BI tools to query the Enterprise Data Warehouse and extract data necessary for ad-hoc analysis.




Your impact:

As a Data Analyst, you will be essential in data modeling and analysis across company projects, ensuring high-quality, high-performance data products for end users. You will work closely with internal teams to uphold the highest standards in data product development.




Requirements:




A B.S. or M.S. in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or Management Information Systems.
Strong experience with Power BI and/or SQL Server/Azure Analysis Services.
Hands-on experience with the Power BI/SSAS/AAS ecosystem (e.g., DAX Studio, Tabular Editor, ALM Toolkit).
Practical experience with DAX, SQL, and Power Query for data modeling and analysis.
Solid understanding of dimensional data modeling principles.
Proficiency with version control systems like Git.
In-depth knowledge of data analysis best practices.




Preferred (a plus):

Experience with Snowflake or Databricks.
Python for Data Analysis (e.g., pandas, matplotlib, seaborn, scikit-learn, plotly).
R for Data Analysis (e.g., ggplot2, tidyverse, RMarkdown, Shiny).




Only eligible candidates will be contacted in a maximum of 3 weeks. All information will be treated as strictly confidential.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst ( 1 Year Maternity Cover)

€40,000 - €45,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

Lisbon (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate €22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty’s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Hermès, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Junior Business Data Analyst (All Genders)
Description:
Dailymotion is more than a video platform; it’s a visual conversation in motion, based on a unique algorithm designed to broaden users’ horizons. Dailymotion brings nuance to the debates that animate young people and puts listening, discovery, and kindness back at the heart of interactions to help build a better and safer Internet.

Dailymotion is also “Dailymotion Pro,” a video hosting and broadcasting solution for professionals in all industries, and “Dailymotion Advertising,” a powerful, proprietary video advertising stack offering a high-quality, secure environment for brands.
Our team is made up of 400 people in France, New York, and Singapore, all united by the same ambition: to visibly shake up the global video platform ecosystem.





Job Description



As a Junior Business Data Analyst, you will be at the core of Dailymotion’s data-driven strategy. You will be part of the Operational Insights team, whose mission is to empower sales, ad-operations and publisher teams with right insights and assets to make data-driven decisions and contribute to Dailymotion’s growth.



Under the supervision of a senior business data analyst, your main goal is to provide insights to publisher success, business and ad-operations teams to optimize the monetization of Dailymotion’s large network of publishers.



Monitor frequently the monetization KPIs of top publishers and enhance team responsiveness to quickly identify and address issues.
Build analytical assets (dashboards, datamarts,…) to empower the publisher success team with self-serving tools and ensure adoption and appropriate usage of the assets.
Perform advanced data analysis to provide actionable insights to the Publisher Success team, supporting their efforts in optimizing publisher monetization and retention.
Provide comprehensive analysis to understand the landscape of our publishers, monitor and forecast the evolution of publishers’ supply.
Partner with data engineering/data product team to ensure the accurate tracking of publishers related data


Qualifications


1+ years of quantitative/statistical analysis experience (data analyst, business analyst…); Experience in ads industry highly appreciated but not required
1+ years experience with SQL and a data visualization tool like Looker, Datastudio, Tableau… Python is a plus
Excellent analytical skills : Capacity to understand the business needs, leverage our large and complex dataset to find the appropriate insights and recommendations to solve the business needs
Excellent communication skills : Ability to explain and synthetize analytics work to large audience, ability to foster strong relationships with peers and stakeholders, ability to advocate your findings and influence business decisions
Great sense of ownership : Capacity to be proactive and autonomous with a willingness to get things done
Adaptability and reactivity to shifting priorities and deadlines in a constantly evolving ad-tech industry
Fluent English (written and oral)


Additional Information



Dailymotion is proud to be an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer. We value inclusion and we want you to help us thrive for a more diverse community.
All our job offers are open to people with disabilities or impairments, and we actively encourage everyone to apply. If you have any accessibility needs or require any accommodations for the hiring process, please let us know in advance so that we can make any necessary arrangements.




Location: Issy-les-Moulineaux, France
Type of contract: Permanent
Start Date: ASAP



🏡Hybrid Work Framework (4 types of remote work, depending especially on the needs of your position) : Full office/Flex office (1 to 2 days remote)/Flex remote (1 to 2 days at the office)/Full remote, ability to work 3 months abroad)



💰 Saving Plan Canal +



🍼 Paternity leave or Coparental leave extended



🕶️ Living Employee Culture (Events/Trainings/Parties/All hands,…)



🚀 Career development support (training/internal mobility/compensation cycle/360 feedback review …)



🏥 High-end Health Insurance and Personal Services Vouchers (CESU)



⛱️ Paid Time off – RTT and Saving time plan (CET)



✅ Meal Vouchers – Public Transport and Bike refund



🎡 European Economic and Social Committee (sport membership/cinemas vouchers/gift vouchers/discount)



⚽Fitness Subscription thanks to our partnership with Gymlib



Show more
HTML:
Dailymotion is more than a video platform; it’s a visual conversation in motion, based on a unique algorithm designed to broaden users’ horizons. Dailymotion brings nuance to the debates that animate young people and puts listening, discovery, and kindness back at the heart of interactions to help build a better and safer Internet.

Dailymotion is also “Dailymotion Pro,” a video hosting and broadcasting solution for professionals in all industries, and “Dailymotion Advertising,” a powerful, proprietary video advertising stack offering a high-quality, secure environment for brands.
Our team is made up of 400 people in France, New York, and Singapore, all united by the same ambition: to visibly shake up the global video platform ecosystem.



Job Description

As a Junior Business Data Analyst, you will be at the core of Dailymotion’s data-driven strategy. You will be part of the Operational Insights team, whose mission is to empower sales, ad-operations and publisher teams with right insights and assets to make data-driven decisions and contribute to Dailymotion’s growth.

Under the supervision of a senior business data analyst, your main goal is to provide insights to publisher success, business and ad-operations teams to optimize the monetization of Dailymotion’s large network of publishers.

  • Monitor frequently the monetization KPIs of top publishers and enhance team responsiveness to quickly identify and address issues.
  • Build analytical assets (dashboards, datamarts,…) to empower the publisher success team with self-serving tools and ensure adoption and appropriate usage of the assets.
  • Perform advanced data analysis to provide actionable insights to the Publisher Success team, supporting their efforts in optimizing publisher monetization and retention.
  • Provide comprehensive analysis to understand the landscape of our publishers, monitor and forecast the evolution of publishers’ supply.
  • Partner with data engineering/data product team to ensure the accurate tracking of publishers related data

Qualifications

  • 1+ years of quantitative/statistical analysis experience (data analyst, business analyst…); Experience in ads industry highly appreciated but not required
  • 1+ years experience with SQL and a data visualization tool like Looker, Datastudio, Tableau… Python is a plus
  • Excellent analytical skills : Capacity to understand the business needs, leverage our large and complex dataset to find the appropriate insights and recommendations to solve the business needs
  • Excellent communication skills : Ability to explain and synthetize analytics work to large audience, ability to foster strong relationships with peers and stakeholders, ability to advocate your findings and influence business decisions
  • Great sense of ownership : Capacity to be proactive and autonomous with a willingness to get things done
  • Adaptability and reactivity to shifting priorities and deadlines in a constantly evolving ad-tech industry
  • Fluent English (written and oral)

Additional Information

Dailymotion is proud to be an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer. We value inclusion and we want you to help us thrive for a more diverse community.
All our job offers are open to people with disabilities or impairments, and we actively encourage everyone to apply. If you have any accessibility needs or require any accommodations for the hiring process, please let us know in advance so that we can make any necessary arrangements.


Location: Issy-les-Moulineaux, France
Type of contract: Permanent
Start Date: ASAP

🏡Hybrid Work Framework (4 types of remote work, depending especially on the needs of your position) : Full office/Flex office (1 to 2 days remote)/Flex remote (1 to 2 days at the office)/Full remote, ability to work 3 months abroad)

💰 Saving Plan Canal +

🍼 Paternity leave or Coparental leave extended

🕶️ Living Employee Culture (Events/Trainings/Parties/All hands,…)

🚀 Career development support (training/internal mobility/compensation cycle/360 feedback review …)

🏥 High-end Health Insurance and Personal Services Vouchers (CESU)

⛱️ Paid Time off – RTT and Saving time plan (CET)

✅ Meal Vouchers – Public Transport and Bike refund

🎡 European Economic and Social Committee (sport membership/cinemas vouchers/gift vouchers/discount)

⚽Fitness Subscription thanks to our partnership with Gymlib

Title: Junior - Data Analyst
Description:
The chance to build a better future is right in front of you

Do Work That Matters - Il tuo ruolo e le tue responsabilità

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l’opportunità di aiutare i clienti, la società, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide più attuali e complesse

Il Digital Assurance Team è un team all’avanguardia di KPMG in cui diverse competenze collaborano per dare forma alla digitalizzazione del futuro dei servizi di assurance e revisione contabile. A vrai l’opportunità di lavorare a fianco di revisori esperti sviluppando, attraverso la formazione interna ma soprattutto il training on the job, la capacità di analizzare criticamente i processi aziendali a supporto dell’informativa finanziaria e i dati elaborati dai sistemi informativi delle società identificando elementi di anomalia ed interpretando le dinamiche alla base dei trend economico-finanziari.

Starting date: Settembre 2025

Tipologia di inserimento: Apprendistato

Nello specifico ti occuperai di:


Sviluppo di soluzioni di analytics a supporto dei team di audit (transactional analytics, dashboard di analisi di dati contabili, process mining, KPI di processo, ecc)
Sviluppo di tecniche di revisione basate sull’utilizzo di soluzioni tecnologiche innovative
Supporto ai team nell’utilizzo delle soluzioni proposte
Cura di eventi di comunicazione volti a far conoscere il progetto / le soluzioni


Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche

Questa opportunità è perfetta per te se:


Hai una formazione di base economico-contabile
Hai spiccato interesse per l’area del reporting finanziario e per i data analytics
Hai voglia di imparare e metterti in gioco
Vuoi crescere all’interno di un Network Internazionale


Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG


Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversità
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creatività e il lavoro di squadra
Modalità di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Mindset internazionale e progettualità innovative
Iniziative incentrate sul benessere psicofisico


Together for Better – I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualità, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunità, integrità: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all’impegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network ha ottenuto le certificazioni ISO 30415, che attesta la conformità del Sistema di Gestione per la Diversità e l’Inclusione, e UNI PdR 125, che certifica la parità di genere. All’interno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni concrete che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

Unisciti a noi!

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - "GDPR") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG .

KPMG S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunità.

The chance to build a better future is right in front of you

Responsibilities

Do Work That Matters - Your Role and Responsibilities

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and your colleagues tackle and solve the most current and complex challenges.

The Digital Assurance Team is KPMG’s innovative team which brings together different skill sets to shape the digitalization of the future for assurance and audit services. You will have the opportunity to work alongside expert auditors – through in-house courses and especially on-the-job training – developing the ability to critically analyse the company processes used in financial reporting and the information processed by the companies’ IT systems, identifying errors and interpreting the dynamics underlying financial performance.

Starting date: September 2025

Type of contract : Apprenticeship

Specifically, you will be tasked with:


The development of analytics solutions for audit teams (transactional analytics, dashboards for the analysis of accounting data, process mining, process KPIs, etc.)
The development of audit techniques based on the use of innovative technological solutions
Assistance to the audit teams in using the new solutions
The organization of communication initiatives to raise awareness of the project/solutions.


Skills

Come As You Are - Your Skills and Characteristics

This is the perfect opportunity for you if:


You have a business/accounting background with a degree in business subject
You have a strong interest in financial reporting and data analytics
You have a desire to learn and challenge yourself
You want to grow within an International Network


Your Future With Us - What You Will Find at KPMG


An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages, and values diversity.
A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork. [NL1]
Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
Advanced training and development programs to stay current.
International mindset and innovative projects.
Initiatives focused on physical and mental well-being.


Together for Better – Our Values and Commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect for individuality, continuous learning, transparency, community engagement, integrity: these are the values of KPMG that create an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, allowing our professionals to express their full potential.

Thanks to our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our network has obtained ISO 30415 certification, which attests to the compliance of our Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125 certification, which certifies gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find a summary of all the concrete actions we are taking on environmental, social, and governance (ESG) issues.

Join us!

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - “GDPR”), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG’s privacy policy .

KPMG S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Data Analyst Internship
Description:
About Us

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.




What You Should Know Before Applying

At Allianz, we are committed to ensure a fair hiring process and minimize unconscious bias during the screening phase. At this regard, we ask each candidate to submit their resume including only the essential information for an objective and transparent assessment of skills and experience. For example, it’s preferable to omit the photo or the city of residence before submitting the CV.




Your Challenge

You will be placed in our Milan/Rome office, within the Transformation team, where you will be responsible for supporting process automation and developing data-driven solutions.

You will be primarily responsible for the following activities:

Collaborate with business analysts or automation engineers to identify opportunities for process improvements.
Provide data-driven recommendations to support the design and implementation of automation solutions.
Assist in the development of models or algorithms for predictive analytics or decision-making processes.
Develop and maintain dashboards and regular reports that provide insights into business processes and the performance of automation systems.
Create visual representations of data that can be understood by stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Automate reporting processes where possible to provide real-time data and insights.




You Are the Ideal Candidate If…

You have proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation, and familiarity with programming languages, primarily Python and VBA.
You are competent with data visualization tools like Power BI and have basic knowledge of automation tools for business processes.
You possess skills in cleaning and preparing datasets for analysis, and experience with Excel or similar tools for data manipulation and analysis.
You have strong problem-solving aptitude to identify issues and propose data-driven solutions, and analytical thinking for evaluating data and process efficiencies.
You have collaboration skills to work effectively across different teams, and time management to handle multiple tasks and deadlines efficiently.




Why Working With Us?

Remote working? 10 days per month, plus some days of working from abroad.
360° well-being? We care about your health so you can benefit from dedicated support for your psychophysical well-being.
Discover a flexible and inclusive environment where your peace of mind and personal style truly matter.




Our Values

Customer and Market Excellence: Unwavering commitment and expertise to provide maximum support to those who rely on us.
Collaborative Leadership: Valuing people, promoting a culture of feedback and collective well-being.
Entrepreneurship: Anticipating trends and taking risks in an environment that fosters innovation and responsibility.
Trust: Acting with integrity, honoring commitments, promoting diversity and inclusion, and acting transparently for corporate social responsibility.




Certified as a Great Place to Work, Allianz Trade Italia is recognized for its focus on Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) issues and for promoting a hybrid work environment that best integrates in-person and smart working modes.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in. We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation. Great to have you on board. Let's care for tomorrow.

Title: CRM Data Analyst
HTML:
METRO is a global leader in wholesale food and non-food distribution, serving the needs of hotels, restaurants, catering businesses (HoReCa), and independent traders.

In 2025, we were awarded the Top Employer Romania and Europe certification for the fifth consecutive year. This certification places us among the top employers locally and in Europe. Globally, we are present in 35 countries, with 150,000 employees. We are passionate about supporting the growth of over 24 million customers, which means 24 million different challenges, ambitions and dreams.

METRO Romania was the pioneer in introducing the cash & carry sales system in Romania, in October 1996. Today, METRO Romania means:

  • More than 4,000 employees
  • 30 distribution centers across the country
  • An annual turnover of 10.5 billion lei, marking a 9% growth from the previous year.
  • A total sales area of 190,000 square meters
  • GASTRONOMETRO – Our Culinary Training Center at METRO Militari, a symbol of culinary excellence, where our specialists provide cooking courses and gastronomic consulting services to over 7,500 clients.
  • LaDoiPași – The franchise network developed by METRO, now the largest network of independent stores in Romania, with over 2,400 locations.
  • The global employer branding campaign "Shape the M" in Romania - a recognition of the contribution each METRO employee makes to the success of the company.

We are professionals working for professionals. We do business with passion. It's about speed, results, courage and team spirit. If you think alike, or if you are just curious to learn, apply on this website or log on to https://cariere.metro.ro/

Diversity and inclusion are at the heart of METRO's culture, philosophy and recruitment practices. We are committed to fostering an environment that respects the diverse perspectives, experiences and backgrounds of our employees and to promoting an inclusive, fair and accessible workplace. This includes employees of all races and ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities and sexual orientations, religious and political beliefs, military background and socio-economic status or any other legally protected factor. We ensure that people with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. At METRO, recruitment and hiring processes have been designed to ensure diversity by giving equal opportunities to all individuals, regardless of their diverse perspectives and backgrounds.



Job Description

Are you passionate about turning customer data into actionable insights? We're looking for a CRM Data Analyst to help us better understand and engage our customer base through smart reporting, campaign analysis, and data-driven support for key business initiatives.

What you’ll do:

  • Analyze and report on customer base evolution, helping the business make informed decisions;

  • Deliver performance reports for Call Center and Net Promoter Score (NPS) trends;

  • Run and evaluate SMS campaigns targeting specific customer groups;

  • Provide support for the GDPR permissions collection initiative in stores;

  • Contribute to the ARES Program by updating data (closed companies, former employees, key accounts), sending SMS notifications, and preparing related reports and evaluations.



Qualifications

What we’re looking for:

  • Knowledge of Retail / Wholesale business operations (METRO experience is a big plus);

  • Experience or strong interest in SQL, Python, Google Cloud Platform / BigQuery and Looker;

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills – you enjoy working with others across functions;

  • Curiosity and willingness to learn new tools and business processes;

  • Interest in both data analysis and understanding the business logic behind CRM activities.



Additional Information

We're ready to train and reward you as a #METROCHAMPION:

  • Lunch and holiday are provided by us through meal vouchers and holiday bonus;
  • Your health is a priority for us, that's why you benefit from private medical insurance;
  • Your performance is rewarded with team or individual bonuses;
  • You get extra days off for various occasions;
  • You have access to psychological, financial and legal counselling for you and your family;
  • You get holiday and special occasion bonuses (Christmas, Easter, 1st of June);
  • You get a referral bonus for new #METROCHAMPIONS for our team;
  • You get discounts on medical and sports subscriptions;
  • We value stability and reward it with extra vacation days and loyalty bonuses.

Title: Junior Analyst (Data)
Description:
Overview

Job Description

About The Department

Banking Supervision carries out on-site and ongoing supervision of licensed banks. The Banking Supervision team comprises professionals with a financial services academic background, but also legal and IT professionals to support policy and supervisory work.

About The Role


As Junior Analyst you will be responsible for the following main duties:
Draw up reporting performance assessments for credit institutions, including challenging the quality of data as submitted/published by institutions;
Utilize available data extraction and visualisation tools to interpret data and present findings
Liaison with relevant stakeholders including credit institutions, the ECB, the EBA and others in connection with ongoing and/or ad-hoc tasks;
Proactive participation in exercises and projects undertaken by the Data Team (planned and ad-hoc), including both in-house projects and those with European Supervisory Authorities (EBA, ECB, other);
Support participation in local/EBA/ECB working groups, as well as other European regulatory bodies as may be required;
Assist in the development and implementation of new data collection initiatives and analytical frameworks.
Participate in continuous improvement initiatives to enhance team efficiency and effectiveness
General office management and administrative duties including stationery orders, invoicing, coordinating attendance reports, archiving and other admin-related tasks as necessary;
You will also be expected to undertake any other duties that may arise depending on the exigencies of Banking Supervision and the Authority.


About You

We are looking for candidates with background in Banking, Finance, Accountancy, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or in a related subject.

The role calls for an academic qualification in a relevant field of study at National Qualification Framework Level 6 or better, duly certified by the Malta Qualifications Recognition Information Centre (MQRIC) or a widely recognised professional qualification at a comparable level.

Having experience working in the area of financial services, especially within compliance and/or data, will be considered an asset. Candidates with longer working experience relevant to the role, or with proven knowledge of Excel and Business Intelligence Tools (such as PowerBI) will be preferred.

If you do not have the necessary academic or professional qualifications but you have at least five (5) years of relevant experience within the financial services environment, we would still be interested in speaking with you.

Other Information

The MFSA is an Equal Opportunities Employer as certified by the NCPE (National Commission for the Protection of Equality) and is committed to a policy of equal opportunity in all aspects of employment and will take care to avoid any form of discrimination in its recruitment procedures. The MFSA reserves the right to withdraw this call at any time and not to select any of the Candidates.

It is the responsibility of applicants in possession of qualifications awarded by Universities and other similar institutions outside Malta to produce a recognition statement on comparability of qualifications issued by the Malta Qualifications Recognition Information Centre (MQRIC). Applicants should do so preferably at application stage or otherwise at the preliminary interview should an applicant be selected for such interview. Details can be obtained by accessing the National Commission for Further and Higher Education website on www.ncfhe.gov.mt under MQRIC heading.

The MFSA shall ensure that any processing of personal data is in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation), the Data Protection Act (Chapter 586 of the Laws of Malta) and any other relevant European Union and national law. For further details, you may refer to the Data Protection Policy on the MFSA webpage www.mfsa.mt.

Candidates are to note that the submission of any false statement/s or omission, even if unintended, may lead to the cancellation of their application and may render the candidate's appointment liable to termination.

Furthermore, please note that candidates may be asked to submit any documentation in support of the information provided, including but not limited to, proof of qualifications and Police Conduct Certificates.

Public call number: 881/2023

Title: BALENCIAGA – EMEA Client Engagement Data Analyst Intern (F/H)
Description:
Summary

BALENCIAGA – EMEA Client Engagement Data Analyst Intern (F/H)

About usCristóbal Balenciaga founded the House in 1917 in his home of Spain. In 1937, he established the brand in Paris, designing its collections there until 1968. Cristóbal Balenciaga had a reputation as a couturier of uncompromising standards and was referred to as "the master of us all" by Christian Dior and as “The Couturier of the Couturiers” by Gabrielle Chanel. The ultra-modern shapes were trademarks of the house.

While the brand’s identity is firmly rooted in its highly conceptual prêt-à-porter collections, its leather goods, footwear, and accessories experience worldwide success as well. Among the archetypal products of the House are its handbag collections. A new focus on the development of Balenciaga ready-to-wear collections for men was quickly established as highly successful.

Since October 2015, Demna has designed both men’s and women’s collections as the artistic director.

The Balenciaga House, part of the Kering group since 2001, is one of the most influential names in fashion.

Job Description

BALENCIAGA – EMEA Client Engagement Data Analyst Intern (F/H)

About us
Cristóbal Balenciaga founded the House in 1917 in his home of Spain. In 1937, he established the brand in Paris, designing its collections there until 1968. Cristóbal Balenciaga had a reputation as a couturier of uncompromising standards and was referred to as "the master of us all" by Christian Dior and as “The Couturier of the Couturiers” by Gabrielle Chanel. The ultra-modern shapes were trademarks of the house.       

While the brand’s identity is firmly rooted in its highly conceptual prêt-à-porter collections, its leather goods, footwear, and accessories experience worldwide success as well. Among the archetypal products of the House are its handbag collections. A new focus on the development of Balenciaga ready-to-wear collections for men was quickly established as highly successful.

Since October 2015, Demna has designed both men’s and women’s collections as the artistic director.

The Balenciaga House, part of the Kering group since 2001, is one of the most influential names in fashion.

How you will contribute


Undertake market analysis to identify key trends, challenges, and opportunities
Monthly production and review of KPIs analysis and dashboards
Oversee database quality (data deduplication, profiles merging, single client view)
Leverage data and tools to analyse the client’s purchasing behaviour
Support in the coordination of multiple internal stakeholders, ensuring timely delivery of deliverables and objectives
Assist in a range of market research and ad-hoc projects including competitor monitoring and forecasting with specifics insights


Who you are


At least one previous experience in Data Analysis.
Master’s degree specialized in Finance/Mathematics/Information technology.
Business oriented, confident in managing databases/figures, and conducting data analysis.
Passionate about data and proficient in using business intelligence tools.
Successful track record of managing multiple projects with different priorities.
Strong planning and organization skills.
Ability to transform data queries into comprehensive reports.
Excellent analytical, communication, and presentation skills.
Licenses or Certifications Proficiency in MS Excel, PowerPoint, and SQL.


Why work with us?

Balenciaga is committed to thriving your professional development within the House or in the Kering group. We empower leaders to create, build and sustain high performing teams that excel in execution. We guide every employee to reach their full potential in a stimulating and fulfilling workplace environment.

Diversity commitment

Balenciaga is committed to fostering a diverse workforce. We believe that diversity in all its forms - gender, age, nationality, culture, disability, sexual orientation… - enriches the workplace and our client experience. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we welcome all applications and select our talents based on competencies and in alignment with our brand behaviours. Setting people for success is what we live for. It is part of our interview process to discuss with you how to excel in our company.

Job Type

Student (Fixed Term) (Trainee)

Start Date

2025-01-06

Schedule

Full time

Organization

BALENCIAGA S.A.S.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Talavera de la Reina, Castile-La Mancha, Spain
Description:
¡Hola! 🙋




¿Todavía no conoces HIBERUS TECNOLOGÍA? Somos una empresa de #tecnología construida con un ingrediente diferencial, la HIPERESPECIALIZACIÓN.




Formar parte de Hiberus significa crecimiento, pasión por la tecnología, interés por la innovación, ambiente laboral flexible y colaborativo, compañerismo, aprendizaje, formación continua, motivación y superación ante nuevos retos...y esto es solo el principio.

Somos más de 3.000 profesionales y no paramos de crecer!🙌

Actualmente contamos con más de 36 hubs de desarrollo en España, EEUU, Reino Unido, Alemania, Rumanía, Italia, Andorra, Marruecos, Argentina, México, Ecuador y Colombia ¡Estamos redefiniendo el mapa tecnológico mundial! 🌐 💻




Trabajamos muy duro, para transformar nuestra vida a través de la tecnología y queremos contar contigo para seguir creciendo. Si lo tuyo es el mundo IT, te gusta estar al día en las últimas tecnologías y quieres asumir un nuevo reto profesional ¡Sigue leyendo, te estamos buscando!




🔎¿Qué estamos buscando?

Buscamos un/a Data Analyst con experiencia en Oracle (OAS, OAC, OBIEE). Buscamos una persona que nos ayude a seguir creciendo, con ganas de aportar y seguir evolucionando de la mano de los mejores profesionales, pero sobre todo... ¡en Hiberus buscamos buena gente! 😉




💻Algunas de tus funciones

Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener dashboards y reportes interactivos utilizando Oracle Analytics Server (OAS), Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC) y OBIEE.
Interpretar grandes volúmenes de datos y transformarlos en insights accionables para los equipos de negocio.
Participar en la recolección y análisis de requerimientos para construir soluciones de reporting personalizadas.




🙌¿Qué te ofrecemos?

💼 Contrato indefinido en una compañía puramente tecnológica, que forma parte de un gran grupo, solvente y en crecimiento.

💰 Salario fijo competitivo + bonificación

🏠 Acuerdos de teletrabajo

🏖️ Ambiente familiar, cercano, ¡como una gran familia!

⏰ Conciliación con nuestra vida personal y laboral mediante horario flexible, acuerdos de teletrabajo, desconexión digital, jornada intensiva viernes y verano.

🤙 Cultura “techie”, nos gusta estar en contacto con la tecnología, herramientas, y últimas novedades!

📚 ¡Formación! Siempre que quieras, disfrutarás de un amplio catálogo de cursos formativos, adaptados a tu perfil profesional, inquietudes y novedades del sector. Para ello, pondremos a tu disposición todo el potencial de nuestra Hiberus University y los acuerdos con los principales fabricantes.

💳 ¡Benefíciate! Programa de retribución flexible a medida: seguro médico, tarjeta de transporte público, cheques guardería, tarjeta restaurante, etc.




En Hiberus estamos viviendo un crecimiento explosivo 💥 y queremos que formes parte de nuestro equipo.

Suena bien, ¿verdad? Si quieres saber más, ¡inscríbete y te contamos!

Si quieres saber más busca nuestros hashtag #somoshiberus #lascosasocurrenaquí y conoce todo lo que hacemos.







Hablamos?




www.hiberus.com




#somosHiberus y tú? Te animas?🚀

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a data-driven professional who's excited to transform business questions into actionable insights that drive decisions. In this role, you’ll collaborate with commercial teams, to influence strategic planning and elevate business performance. You will work alongside talented and driven data peers in a dynamic environment to create real impact in HousingAnywhere's growth.

Excited for the challenge? We are excited to hear from you!



Your role & Impact

The purpose of this role is to empower commercial teams with insights and recommendations to grow our marketplace and get the most of our team.


Collaborate closely with the commercial teams to translate business questions into analyses, synthesise insights and develop recommendations to drive business results.
Define, develop and monitor the key metrics to measure operational performance and business outcomes, and identify drivers for changes in these metrics
Ensure business questions are addressed in the most effective format (ad-hoc deep-dive, recurring analysis, dashboards, self-serving functional tools)
Empower stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via dashboards and self-serving tools, in close collaboration with the Analytics Engineering and Business Intelligence teams.
Develop dashboards and reports that support operational business processes.
Support commercial team OKR planning and measurement.
Identify and implement opportunities to enhance existing analytical processes and methodologies




Your team

Our Commercial Analytics and Business Intelligence team is formed by 4 analysts from diverse backgrounds and experience levels. We collaborate closely with data engineers, analytics engineers, and data scientists to extract insights and drive informed decision-making.



Your profile

Required:


4+ years experience as a Data Analyst, or equivalent role with a strong data/analytics component.
Analytical mindset, combined with good business sense and orientation.
A good communicator who can present insights and recommendations clearly and persuasively to different audiences
Self-starter with strong project and time management skills.
Proficient in SQL and Google Sheets, and experience with at least one dashboarding tool (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, etc.)


Preferred


Advanced knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.) is a plus
Previous experience in a high-growth, fast-paced tech company is a big plus.
Experience creating interactive dashboards in Tableau


What’s in it for you


Unlimited paid holidays, minimum-based not maximum!
Hybrid working policy with 2 days working from the office.
Flexibility to work remotely for up to 2 months per year!
1,000 EUR personal development budget.
Complete coverage for commuting.
30% ruling application assistance.
Personal equipment, including laptop and ergonomic setup.
Gym membership discount with GoVital or OneFit.
Dutch/English classes budget.
Variable pension scheme.
Diverse international community (46+ nationalities).
Pet-friendly office in Rotterdam city centre.
Fun team-building and after-work drinks every Friday.


About HousingAnywhere Group

HousingAnywhere is Europe’s largest mid-term rental platform, covering over 125 cities across Europe and several in the US. With Kamernet and Studapart under its umbrella, HousingAnywhere empowers people to live wherever and however they choose. Through our advanced online platforms, which together attract over 30 million users annually, we connect young professionals and students directly with accommodation providers. Our team of 250 professionals is dedicated to helping tenants find comfort and peace of mind in their rental search, whether they're looking for a home across the globe or just across town.

Our mission

Rent Easy, Live Free.

Our Values


Ownership
We are Enablers
We are Changemakers
We are Connectors


If you have further questions, please email Iris at i.fernandes@housinganywhere.com

  • Highly motivated personality with strong problem solving skills
  • Team player – able to work with cross functional units


Location: Budapest

Title: Senior Data Analyst (,)
Description:
En BETWEEN te ofrecemos las oportunidades que necesitas para alcanzar tus objetivos profesionales. Si quieres desarrollar tus capacidades en IT e Ingeniería ¡este es tu próximo destino!

Damos soporte en una gran variedad de áreas como Firmware, Software, BI, Diseño, Project Management y muchas más. Además, desarrollamos soluciones tecnológicas a medida desde nuestros BETWEEN Labs.

Estamos buscando un/a Senior Data Analyst para ampliar uno de nuestros equipos en el área de analítica promocional/análisis de ventas en importante empresa del sector Retail en Madrid.

Funciones


Analizar y sintetizar grandes volúmenes de datos utilizando herramientas como SQL (Snowflake), Python y Excel para extraer información valiosa que ayude en la toma de decisiones estratégicas.
Diseñar dashboards interactivos y reportes utilizando PowerBI y MicroStrategy, asegurando que los stakeholders accedan a información clara y relevante.
Implementar modelos de análisis estadístico, incluyendo estadística descriptiva y análisis de series temporales, específicamente en el sector Retail.
Trabajar con plataformas como Snowflake, PySpark y Snowpark para optimizar los procesos de análisis y mejorar la eficiencia en la gestión de datos.
Extraer, transformar y analizar datos en SQL
Traducir datos complejos en conclusiones claras y accionables
Identificar necesidades y requisitos colaborando con los distintos equipos de negocio (Compras, MKT, …)
Análisis del desempeño de promociones y campañas comerciales mediante seguimiento y evaluación de KPIs


Beneficios

En BETWEEN Creemos En Cuidar De Nuestros Empleados y Ofrecer Un Entorno Que Fomente Su Desarrollo Profesional. Por Ello, Te Ofrecemos


Seguro médico con Sanitas para garantizar tu bienestar y el de tu familia.
Oportunidades de formación en idiomas, certificaciones, bootcamps y mucho más, para ayudarte a continuar creciendo en tus áreas de interés.
Participación en una variedad de eventos sociales y de team building como BETWEEN Night, Torneo de Padel, Black Mamba Race, entre otros, que fomentan la cohesión y el trabajo en equipo.
Retribución flexible que incluye beneficios como comedores, transporte y guarderías, para que puedas organizar tu salario de la manera que mejor te convenga.
Incentivos por validar o recomendar talento, reconociendo así la importancia de contar con un equipo diverso y capacitado.


Requisitos


Formación: Grado en Matemáticas, Física o Ingeniería
Conocimientos en estadística descriptiva y series temporales
Tecnologías requeridas: SQL (snowflake), Python, Excel, PowerBI, Azure Synapse.
Tecnologías deseables: PySpark, Snowpark, MicroStrategy
Muy valorable experiencia en sector Retail o proyectos de analítica promocional y análisis de ventas.


Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

At Sanofi, we’re committed to transform the practice of medicine through break-through science. Within Sanofi, Manufacturing & Supply (M&S) is the bridge between Science and Patients, ensuring all patients get their dose reliably, that new medicines are launched faster to cover unmet needs and that they can be delivered affordably across the globe. At Sanofi we are convinced that Manufacturing is, and must in the future increasingly be, a competitive advantage and that digital unlocks every next step in that journey.

Join Sanofi Manufacturing & Supply (M&S): Where Innovation Meets Life-Saving Impact in the Heart of Lyon!

Imagine working in a vibrant startup environment, right in Lyon's bustling city center! 🏙️

Sanofi M&S offers an unparalleled playground at the intersection of drug development, advanced manufacturing, and cutting-edge AI. Here, you'll:


Support 12 blockbuster launch teams and 40 global factories across R&D and M&S
Work with real-time IoT data from state-of-the-art production and laboratory equipment
Contribute to one of the strongest treatment pipelines in biopharma
Collaborate with world-class scientists, engineers, and experts driving digital transformation


As part of our Digital M&S Accelerator, you'll develop high-value digital products to:


Accelerate yearly launches of 3-5 new blockbuster medicines (€1B+ annual revenue each)
Create best-in-class digitalized "Lighthouse" factories
Drive manufacturing performance to reduce costs by over €500M in the next five years


But wait, there's more! 🎉

Your innovative journey takes place in a prime location:


Embrace the startup vibe in our cutting-edge office space
Enjoy countless amenities right at your doorstep – from nice cafés to restaurants
Benefit from excellent public transport connections for an easy commute
Experience the perfect blend of work and life in one of France's most dynamic cities Ready to shape the future of biomanufacturing, make a real-world impact on patients' lives, and do it all from an amazing location


Join us in Lyon and be part of something extraordinary! 🚀💡

Main Responsibilities


Perform data analysis and provide input to solution design and architecture to ensure the solution meets requirements
Actively solicit stakeholder feedback on solutions and drive improvements as needed
Extracts, aggregates, manipulates, categorizes, cleans, and transforms data associated within an identified problem space
Work in close collaboration with Data scientists and data engineers to identify the right data and define proper data models
Performs exploratory data analysis and feature generation
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Create compelling data stories through great visualizations using cutting-edge technologies
Drive alignment across stakeholders on enterprise data models and definitions
Partner with stakeholders to get buy-in on, develop, and implement Sanofi’s data management standards, policies, and best practices
Implement data management and data governance best practices and standards
Recommend KPIs and develop reports to monitor adoption of and adherence to data management standards
Participate to the data analyst community of practice


As a Data Analyst, you will have a direct impact on the business by deriving insights from Data and ensuring the quality, usability, and security of Sanofi’s data. You are analytical, creative, and collaborative. You have keen attention to detail and take the time to understand our stakeholders’ data needs and challenges. You continually seek to improve your knowledge of new technologies and industry standards to drive the development of simple, yet effective solutions. You enjoy partnering with stakeholders to design and implement data management best practices and procedures. You are a self-starter, see challenges as opportunities, and are results oriented. You take pride knowing your work enables innovation and helping Sanofi build better solution.

Experience

About you


Strong understanding of databases and data structures
Exposure to tools used to support data management, specifically business glossary and metadata management, data cataloging, and data quality
Strong ability to identify, quantify, and effectively raise business risks associated with data quality or non-compliance
Experience developing best Lean & Agile practices, policies, and/or procedures
Rigorous, attention to detail to map data systems and curious to understand what is behind each data field
Understanding of privacy laws and regulations such as GxP
Experience in a healthcare company, manufacturing and supply field or chemical industry is a strong plus


Soft Skills


Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience working with multiple teams to drive alignment and results
Service-oriented, flexible, positive team player
Self-motivated, takes initiative
Problem solving & critical thinking


Technical Skills


Strong experience in SQL writing and profiling of Data & Python
Familiarity with data science methods and scaling data science methods
Good knowledge of cloud computing and data storages. Knowing AWS is a plus
One or multiple of the following visualization skills: Tableau, PowerBI, seaborn, matplolib, plotly, ggplot, bokeh
Project management & support: JIRA projects & service desk, Confluence, Teams


Education


Preferred qualifications: Master’s Degree in Data Analytics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics


Languages


English, French


Why choose us?


We provide a highly collaborative environment, with an opportunity to work with a world class team
Contribute to a company that is not only a leader in healthcare but also a pioneer in digital transformation, shaping the future of global health
Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team
Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it’s through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally
Enjoy a thoughtful, well-crafted rewards package that recognizes your contribution and amplifies your impact
Take good care of yourself and your family, with a wide range of health and wellbeing benefits including high-quality healthcare, prevention and wellness programs and at least 14 weeks’ gender-neutral parental leave
Play an instrumental part in creating best practice within our manufacturing facility


Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. You can be one of those people. Chasing change, embracing new ideas and exploring all the opportunities we have to offer. Let’s pursue progress. And let’s discover extraordinary together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!

  • Rigorous, attention to detail to map data systems and curious to understand what is behind each data field

  • Experience in a healthcare company, manufacturing and supply field or chemical industry is a strong plus

Soft Skills

  • Experience working with multiple teams to drive alignment and results

  • Problem solving & critical thinking

  • One or multiple of the following visualization skills: Tableau, PowerBI, seaborn, matplolib, plotly, ggplot, bokeh
  • Project management & support: JIRA projects & service desk, Confluence, Teams

Why choose us?

  • We provide a highly collaborative environment, with an opportunity to work with a world class team

Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Job Description

Job summary: Support the BI strategy for our European NIQ clients, enabling them to self-serve using our tools. Scope, build and deliver solutions that meet their basic recurrent data needs. Leverage NIQ and third parties solutions to meet your value delivered target

Qualifications:


1-3 years of experience in client servicing in FMCG sector, especially in Business Intelligence
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Fluentcy in English
Proven experience in BI tools and data analysis such as Discover (NIQ) or PowerBI, Microstrategy
Previous experience working with: Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Passion for learning and applying new technologies to business solutions.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Demonstrated project management skills and ability to manage multiple priorities
Building and maintaining effective work relationships
Good collaboration skills to meet client needs and achieve organizational goals
Ability to work in a remote-based environement


Key responsibilities:


Assist NIQ clients in understanding and utilizing BI tools effectively
Develop and propose BI solutions tailored to clients' recurrent data needs
Deliver on performance tracking and success measurement
Consult directly with clients and stakeholders on how to optimize uses of BI tools, applications for automation, analytics and reporting
Identify leads from client interactions, be able to channel these needs into business opportunities
Own end-to-end processes of in-scope reporting solutions across a variety of data sources (RMS, CPS, Omni)
Collaborate with internal teams to ensure client requirements are met
Work closely with manager and team leaders to assist in day-to-day BI customer support needs, deployment activities and transformation initiatives
Aid in user education for platform-specific instruction to drive usage/adoption of Business Intelligence tools and supporting clients with our performance measurement services.
Share best demonstrated practices in an open, creative and inclusive team culture.
Collaborate with fellow BI and Insights teammates to identify business process improvements, project efficiencies and revenue opportunities.
Be active and engaged in continuous learning opportunities to upskill yourself, our team and advance our core areas of expertise.


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Silbing is working with a leading organisation in Brussels looking for a Data Analyst to join on a 6-month contract (with likely extension). A great chance to shape high-impact projects in a fast-paced, international setting.




The role:




You’ll work with large datasets, build dashboards, and deliver insights that directly support strategic decisions




Key responsibilities:




Analyse complex data to uncover trends and insights
Build and optimise dashboards (Power BI, Tableau, etc.)
Work closely with stakeholders to understand requirements
Translate data into clear recommendations
Support data quality initiatives




Requirements




3+ years as a Data Analyst
Strong SQL and Excel
Experience with modern BI tools
Excellent communication – English essential, Dutch/French a bonus
Proactive and independent mindset

Title: ALTERNANCE | Data Analyst Apprentice
Description:
Position

Lorsque vous rejoignez Moët Hennessy (MH), vous entamez un parcours de carrière avec les leaders des vins, champagnes et spiritueux de luxe au sein du prestigieux groupe LVMH. Entrez dans un monde de possibilités, où les opportunités de développement de carrière à travers nos 27 Maisons, cinq régions mondiales et l'ensemble du groupe LVMH sont inégalées. Vous gérerez votre propre carrière au sein d'une main-d'œuvre passionnée et diversifiée qui s'étend sur quatre générations et combine une richesse de rôles et de compétences. L'esprit de conquête et le savoir-faire durable de nos fondateurs audacieux, passés et présents, libéreront votre créativité et vous inspireront à façonner le prochain chapitre de notre histoire intemporelle. En tant que membre de notre communauté engagée à travers le monde, et grâce aux engagements de notre programme mondial, Living Soils Living Together, vous nous aiderez à construire un héritage durable pour notre planète et pour les générations à venir.

Aux côtés de nos équipes dynamiques, vous donnerez vie aux valeurs uniques qui définissent notre parcours collectif : partage, élégance, épicurisme, intégrité et esprit de conquête.

Si vous souhaitez inspirer et être inspiré, créer des expériences et vivre le meilleur de l'artisanat, Moët Hennessy est l'endroit où vous vous épanouirez.

Job Responsibilities

Automatisation des Processus et Gestion de Projet :


Participer à l’extraction des données et l'automatisation des processus métiers liés au contrôle interne et à l’audit interne (Python, SQL, VBA, Power Automate etc.),
Travailler sur l’amélioration continue des pratiques du contrôle et audit interne en analysant les données disponibles pour identifier les tendances ou anomalies pertinentes,
Contribuer à la conception et à la maintenance des tableaux de bord Power BI pour les contrôleurs internes et auditeurs internes,
Participer à la gestion quotidienne des projets incluant la planification et le suivi des progrès via les outils de planification (ex. JIRA),
Préparer les supports de communication nécessaires pour les réunions de projet, tels que les slides PowerPoint, rapports d’avancement, comptes rendus, etc,
Assurer une communication fluide entre toutes les parties prenantes impliquées dans les missions d’audit interne et avec la communauté du Contrôle Interne,


Participer à la préparation des missions d'audit interne :


Extraction des données depuis SAP
Analyse et intégration des données dans nos rapports Power BI,
Contrôle de la cohérence des données,
Accompagnement des auditeurs dans la compréhension des données,
Participation à la réalisation des tests d’audit
Partage des conclusions avec toutes les parties prenantes (entités, maisons, etc.),
Contribution à la rédaction des rapports d'audit,


Audit IT :


Préparation des travaux d’audit IT (Demande de documents, préparation de fiches de tests, analyse des documents obtenues etc.)
Collecte, analyse et interprétation des données,
Réalisation d’échantillonnages et de tests,
Contribution à la rédaction des rapports d'audit


Profile

Formation & expérience :


École d'ingénieur en informatique ou Miage


Langues :


Français et Anglais


Compétences personnelles et interpersonnelles :


Bac+4/5
Connaissance des langages de programmation (Python, SQL, VBA)
Maîtrise d’Excel et Power BI
Connaissance des systèmes d’information (SAP est un plus)
Rigueur, agilité, sens du service, curiosité
Esprit d’équipe, initiative et autonomie
Connaissance des principes de contrôle interne et d'audit interne est un plus


Additional Information


Dates : A partir de Septembre/Octobre 2025
Lieu : Paris 7ème
Remboursement des transports à 75%
Carte de tickets-restaurant à 50%

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft’s 19,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile brings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we’re transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft’s Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you’ll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid Work Model
Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule: 40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM – 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule (35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours: 24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays: 25 days per year + 1 day in your Ubi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday days on the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200€ per month, and Flexible compensation plan (Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance with Cigna, including Physiotherapist & Psychology sessions with a reduced price.
Life Insurance with AXA.
Mobile Device Grant of 400 EUR starting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings in English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount and Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee by INCAPTO (it’s very, very good).
Show more
