Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Participa en innovadores proyectos del sector energía eléctrica, aportando al equipo tu experiencia como Analista de Datos




En ALTEN tenemos claro que el éxito de nuestros proyectos se debe a las personas que forman nuestro equipo. Por eso, si tienes al menos 2 años de experiencia como analista de datos, nos comprometemos a impulsar tu talento, satisfacer tus expectativas laborales y hacerte sentir como en casa. ¿Quieres construir hoy el mundo de mañana? ¡Sigue leyendo!




Principales funciones:




Desarrollo y mantenimiento de herramientas para mantenimiento y construcción (DataFabric).
Creación y mejora de informes en Microsoft Fabric y Denodo.
Seguimiento de planificación anual y actividad en campo.
Asignación de personal (MOP) y control de recursos (materiales y servicios externos).
Gestión de descargos, condicionantes técnicos y riesgos operativos.
Seguimiento económico y reporting.
Apoyo en la implantación del Sistema de Gestión Integrada (PMP/ISO21500, ISO55000, EFQM).
Soporte administrativo: presupuestos, pedidos, contratos, EIMEs y hand over.




¿Qué buscamos?

Formación Académica: Grado / Máster en Ingeniería de Software, Informática, Industrial, Computer Science, Data Analyst, Big Data, Data Science, o similar
Experiencia con PowerBI, QuickSight y SQL para BBDD
Experiencia con SAP R3 y HANA
Valorable experiencia en proyectos sector eléctrico relacionados con instalaciones eléctricas




¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?

Formar parte de una gran empresa competitiva y en continuo crecimiento.
Integración en un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificado, con un buen clima laboral, innovador y dinámico.
Formación especializada y desarrollo profesional continuo.
Beneficios sociales y plan de compensación flexible.
Retribución competitiva.




¿Quiénes somos?

Somos un equipo. Formamos parte de ALTEN, una multinacional europea especializada en proporcionar servicios de consultoría, tecnología de la información y servicios de ingeniería a las principales compañías del mercado español.

Si te gustan las cifras, te diremos que en España tenemos una facturación de 217 millones de euros, 9 sedes y un equipo formado por 5.240 personas.

Además, en ALTEN nos enorgullecemos de ofrecer igualdad de oportunidades con independencia de género, edad, diversidad de capacidades o país de origen. Nuestro compromiso está con el talento y con las personas que lo tienen.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Kryptonim is revolutionizing the crypto industry as a fiat onramp provider.

We are a platform that seamlessly enables users to exchange fiat currency for cryptocurrency, integrating essential elements from both the crypto and fiat worlds, including robust Know Your Customer (KYC) protocols, advanced risk management, diverse payment options, and access to substantial crypto liquidity.

Kryptonim delivers a secure and user-friendly payment experience, embodying our mission to make digital assets accessible and safe. By simplifying cryptocurrency purchases, we aim to foster a transparent and inclusive crypto culture.

We are working from our office in Warsaw, which provides the core environment for our work. You have the flexibility to work remotely twice a week.

We're looking for a development-hungry Data Analyst to join our team and support business-oriented analytic processes, scope, and implement tooling for analytics automation. Your insights will help optimize conversion rates across entire customer funnels, detect anomalies, and identify areas for improvement. You'll also help shape how data is accessed and used by the team, making it easier for stakeholders to make data-driven decisions.

Salary range on this position is 15 000 - 20 000 PLN net+vat.

Your Responsibilities Include


Insights Generation: Analyze data to optimize conversion funnels, track anomalies on micro and macro scale, and recommend actions to enhance performance.
AB Testing & Benchmarking: Conduct experiments and performance benchmarking to drive evidence-based changes.
Analytical Tool Development: Create and improve tools to make data easily accessible for stakeholders.
Financial Analysis: Dive into transactional data for financial insights.


We're Looking For Someone With


Experience: At least 3 years of proven experience in data analysis, ideally in payments, open banking, or related industries.
Technical Skills:
Experience with SQL (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and Python to extract and manage data.
Proficiency in data analysis & visualization tools like Metabase, Looker, PowerBI or similar BI tools.
Ability to design and manage data pipelines for smooth data flow.
Experience in building analytical toolsets.
Analytical Mindset: Ability to turn complex data into clear, actionable insights.
Problem Solver: Eager to tackle challenges and make meaningful contributions.
Team Player: Comfortable collaborating with cross-functional teams and translating technical data for non-technical stakeholders.
Adaptability: Ability to maintain productivity in a fast-changing environment.


We'd love to hear from you if you're ready to make data work harder and smarter. Apply today and help us transform the payment experience through the power of data.

Our benefits see what perks we've prepared for you!

Growth support 🌱

As the company grows, so does your role, ensuring your voice matters in strategic decisions. Participate in enriching feedback sessions, with limitless access to educational resources and language courses for your personal and professional development. Receive regular feedback during 1–on–1 meetings, we’re creating a culture based on continuous improvement. Our employees have unlimited access to educational platforms.

Health & Wellbeing 🧘‍♀️🧘‍♂️

We care about our employees’ health. We offer private medical care, in-office diagnostic tests, and a Multisport card. We believe in mixing business with pleasure, and so there are also sports activities available to our employees!

Work & time off 💼🌴

You will have 26 days off, regardless of how long you’ve been with us, and additional special days off. Sick days are paid in full. We have a flexible schedule, and we operate from a comfortable office in Warsaw Spire.

Community 🥳

We believe in a culture of appreciation. Attend industry conferences. We organize office theme parties, contests, and integration events as well as provide funds for group outings.

Office life 🏰

Yes, we know there's more to life than a gorgeous view from the office. That’s guaranteed in our office on the 40th floor of Warsaw Spire. However, we also celebrate little things together, like the International Pancake or Chocolate Day.

Recruitment process 🤝

Our recruitment process is designed to be transparent and engaging, ensuring we find the right match for our team and projects.

Here’s What You Can Expect

Apply Online

Submit your application on our website and fill out the accompanying form.

HR call

A brief conversation with our HR team to learn more about your background and interests. This is the first personal touchpoint on your journey with us.

Take-Home interview assignment

Softskills & Tech Interview

We will schedule a meeting in our office to discuss your professional experiences and expectations. You’ll also tackle problems similar to those you would encounter in your potential role, allowing us to assess your problem-solving skills.

Offer of Cooperation

Shortly after our meeting, if we decide to proceed, you will receive an offer from us to start our collaboration!

We look forward to reviewing your application and potentially welcoming you to our team! 🥳
Show more

    • Analytical Mindset: Ability to turn complex data into clear, actionable insights.
    • Problem Solver: Eager to tackle challenges and make meaningful contributions.
    • Team Player: Comfortable collaborating with cross-functional teams and translating technical data for non-technical stakeholders.
    • Adaptability: Ability to maintain productivity in a fast-changing environment.

    We'd love to hear from you if you're ready to make data work harder and smarter. Apply today and help us transform the payment experience through the power of data.

    Our benefits see what perks we've prepared for you!

    Growth support 🌱

    As the company grows, so does your role, ensuring your voice matters in strategic decisions. Participate in enriching feedback sessions, with limitless access to educational resources and language courses for your personal and professional development. Receive regular feedback during 1–on–1 meetings, we’re creating a culture based on continuous improvement. Our employees have unlimited access to educational platforms.

    Health & Wellbeing 🧘‍♀️🧘‍♂️

    We care about our employees’ health. We offer private medical care, in-office diagnostic tests, and a Multisport card. We believe in mixing business with pleasure, and so there are also sports activities available to our employees!

    Work & time off 💼🌴

    You will have 26 days off, regardless of how long you’ve been with us, and additional special days off. Sick days are paid in full. We have a flexible schedule, and we operate from a comfortable office in Warsaw Spire.

    Community 🥳

    We believe in a culture of appreciation. Attend industry conferences. We organize office theme parties, contests, and integration events as well as provide funds for group outings.

    Office life 🏰

    Yes, we know there's more to life than a gorgeous view from the office. That’s guaranteed in our office on the 40th floor of Warsaw Spire. However, we also celebrate little things together, like the International Pancake or Chocolate Day.

    Recruitment process 🤝

    Our recruitment process is designed to be transparent and engaging, ensuring we find the right match for our team and projects.

    Here’s What You Can Expect

    Apply Online

    Submit your application on our website and fill out the accompanying form.

    HR call

    A brief conversation with our HR team to learn more about your background and interests. This is the first personal touchpoint on your journey with us.

    Take-Home interview assignment

    Softskills & Tech Interview

    We will schedule a meeting in our office to discuss your professional experiences and expectations. You’ll also tackle problems similar to those you would encounter in your potential role, allowing us to assess your problem-solving skills.

    Offer of Cooperation

    Shortly after our meeting, if we decide to proceed, you will receive an offer from us to start our collaboration!

    We look forward to reviewing your application and potentially welcoming you to our team! 🥳

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are changing the way people buy cars, fixing the largely broken used cars sector.

Spotawheel, an Endeavor company, is a trusted high-tech used cars B2C platform that redesigned the whole buy-sell process from scratch, ensuring value, transparency, and customer satisfaction at the highest levels throughout.

Launched in 2015, we are currently incorporated in 3 countries, growing aggressively towards our mission of disrupting the €500 billion European market. Spotawheel has been recognized as one of Europe's fastest-growing companies for three consecutive years, 2021, 2022 & 2023, by the Financial Times.

Unlike traditional used car dealers, we rely on advanced proprietary technology to be much more efficient in how we work, sustaining top vehicle quality and customer experience at a large scale.

Our people at Spotawheel are our driving force, and we trust them to meet and exceed our customers' expectations. We invest in our people first and foremost, so that to create a culture of excellence, recognition and ethics that is, above all fun to be a part of.

We are currently looking for a passionate Data Analyst to join our team in Athens.

Our Data Analyst will help us turn data into information, information into insight, and insight into business decisions. The role's responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities, and design; will develop analysis and reporting capabilities.

Your Key Responsibilities will be to:

Work with large datasets in BigQuery to extract, transform, and analyze data.
Build interactive dashboards and reports in Tableau and Google Data Studio.
Use Python for data analysis and ad hoc reporting.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support decision-making with clear data insights.
Identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities using structured and unstructured data.



Requirements


Studies in Economics, Computer Science, Statistics, or related fields
3-5 years of working experience in data analysis
Working Experience with business intelligence, data integration, analysis, report creation, and data visualization
Working Experience with reporting tools, such as Tableau, Power BI, and Google Data Studio
Working experience with data warehouses, such as BigQuery and SQL
Proficiency in Python
Knowledge of statistical tools and business reporting
Experience with MS Office (Excel, etc) and G-Suite (Google Sheets, etc)
Excellent command of the English language, both written and verbal
High attention to detail, willingness to learn, and strong analytical skills




Benefits


Spotawheel Stock Option Plan
Group Health Insurance Program
Daily exposure on top-notch technologies, practices and methodologies
Professional development plan & specialization in a high-demand market
Unlimited support to achieve your personal aspirations
Values based, fun and fast-paced environment
Show more

Title: JUNIOR DATA ANALYST
Description:
Vuoi essere parte del cambiamento digitale e della trasformazione tecnologica?

Hai esperienza in ambito ICT e vuoi lavorare su progetti innovativi?

Potremmo avere l’opportunità giusta per te!

Grafton ICT* è un team dedicato a valorizzare le esperienze, le competenze e il potenziale dei candidati in ambito AI, Data, Cybersecurity, Cloud, ERP & CRM, Sistemi e Infrastrutture, IMAC e Sviluppo.

Siamo un team di professionisti appassionati, lavoriamo per accompagnare i nostri candidati verso le mansioni ed i contesti aziendali più coerenti con le loro competenze e le loro aspettative.

Per Azienda Cliente Del Settore Energetico Selezioniamo

JUNIOR DATA ANALYST

Di cosa ti occuperai?


Estrazione, elaborazione, analisi e monitoraggio dati (es. i principali parametri di processo che caratterizzano il funzionamento delle reti e delle utenze di teleriscaldamento), attraverso l’utilizzo di strumenti di self-BI, al fine di identificare trend, descrivere comportamenti, individuare eventuali criticità e produrre reportistica
Supporto alla gestione e alla bonifica di dati cartografici attraverso il confronto tra diverse sorgenti per individuare errori, dati anomali o incompleti
Supporto ai colleghi di altre funzioni per l’estrazione dati e la creazione di reportistiche/dashboard
Interfaccia con la funzione IT e con fornitori per l’implementazione di soluzioni per l’analisi, la raccolta e la gestione dei dati, anche con algoritmi AI
Supporto nelle attività di Data Governance per la catalogazione dei dati e il mantenimento degli stessi garantendone qualità ed integrità
Supporto all’automazione e miglioramento del processo di raccolta, analisi ed elaborazione dati in diversi ambiti aziendali (es. Regolazione Qualità Tecnica ARERA)
Supporto all’implementazione di modelli per la simulazione fluidodinamica delle reti di teleriscaldamento


Hai queste competenze e caratteristiche?


Laurea magistrale in Ingegneria Informatica, Matematica o percorsi affini
Esperienza pregressa di 2-3 anni, coerente con il ruolo in ricerca
Buona conoscenza del pacchetto Office
Preferibile conoscenza di: sistema GIS, database relazionali (SQL), linguaggio Python, strumenti di business intelligence (Power BI, Qlik Sense, ecc.)
Preferibile conoscenza di metodologie di Machine Learning e AI
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese, sia scritta che orale
Patente di guida B
Eventuale disponibilità a trasferte sul territorio ed occasionalmente all’estero
Completano il profilo: capacità di lavoro in team ed in contesti strutturati, capacità di relazione con interlocutori differenti, orientamento al risultato, capacità analitica, attitudine al problem solving, organizzazione e pianificazione, proattività.


Orario di lavoro: settimana lavorativa con venerdì a orario ridotto, flessibilità negli orari di entrata/uscita e pausa pranzo

Offerta Contrattuale: Contratto: tempo indeterminato diretto

Smartworking sino al 60% dell’orario di lavoro su base bimestrale

Luogo di lavoro: BRESCIA

Se pensi di avere le competenze e l’attitudine per questo ruolo, inviaci la tua candidatura!


Grafton ICT è una specializzazione di Gi Group Spa autorizzata ad operare dal Ministero del Lavoro e delle Politiche Sociali (Aut. Min. 26/11/2004 PROT. 1101 - SG).


L’offerta si intende rivolta ai candidati nel rispetto del D.lgs. n. 198/2006 e ss.mm.ii. e dei Decreti Legislativi n. 215 e n. 216 del 2003 sulle parità di trattamento.

I candidati sono invitati a leggere l’informativa privacy ai sensi degli artt. 13 e 14 del Reg. EU 679/2016 al seguente indirizzo www.gigroup.it/privacy-candidati


Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst UK&I
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, provide digital marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to accomplish their financial goals and help them to save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in accomplished people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data and improve. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland.

Job Description

What you will do:

You will provide data processing, services and solutions, within a data environment, to businesses with simple and complex needs. You will work for clients across many sectors including Banking, Energy and Telecommunications.


Engage with Account Managers to ensure requirements and data deliveries are understood and fulfilled to expectations.
Collaborate with internal and external partners to ensure deliveries to our clients.
Run simple and complex batch processes to deliver data to clients.
Simple and complex coding to extract data from files to underpin data activities.
Involvement in delivery of high-quality work within agreed timescales, contributing to overall client project goals
Provision of counts and profile analysis to support campaign and strategic activity for clients
Manage creating, modifying and monitoring of automated processes for clients
Maintain the codebase and incorporate any new developments


You will report into the Senior Delivery Consultant.

Qualifications

What you will bring:


Experience of SQL
Demonstrate analytical thinking with experience solving numerical and data problem
Understanding of data, data structures and their value regarding use for data processing and data delivery
Experienced in building relationships with colleagues by email, phone, video conference and face-to-face meetings
Experience managing multiple tasks


Additional Information

What you will get:


Personal Development - career pathway for professional growth supported by learning and development programs and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials & book.
Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefit package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance, monthly flex allowance and internet coverage, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many other benefits!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in Social responsibility event.
Opportunity for Flexible working hours and Home Office.


Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Analista de datos SQL/PowerBI
Description:
NTT DATA BPO, es una sociedad perteneciente al grupo NTT DATA, la cual presta servicios de externalización de procesos de negocio. NTT DATA es una consultora multinacional que ofrece soluciones de negocio, estrategia, desarrollo y mantenimiento de aplicaciones tecnológicas, y outsourcing. La compañía, desarrolla su actividad en los sectores de telecomunicaciones, entidades financieras, industria, utilities, energía, administración pública y sanidad.




Somos la sexta compañía de servicios IT del mundo, lo que nos permite dar soluciones y servicios en diversas áreas, aumentando las capacidades, recursos tecnológicos, geográficos y financieros de nuestros clientes, además de ayudarles dando las respuestas más innovadoras.




Somos una de las pocas compañías en España, con los estándares más altos de excelencia en las condiciones que ofrecemos a nuestros empleados, por eso estamos certificados como Top Employer desde 2016 hasta la actualidad. Apostamos por nuestros empleados y creemos por encima de todo en las personas y en su desarrollo integral, por lo que fomentamos un contexto de libertad responsable que se traduce en un alto rendimiento profesional.




Para nuestra oficina de Santander buscamos una persona con experiencia en análisis de datos y reporting, cuyas funciones serán:




Creación y mantenimiento de queries.
Desarrollo de informes en Power BI.
Desarrollo de ETLs en Python.




Conocimientos necesarios:




Conocimiento de bases de datos y modelos de datos PowerQuery/SQL.
Desarrollo de informes de Business Intelligence con PowerBI.
Experiencia en la explotación, análisis y construcción de reporting.
Desarrollo de consultas SQL optimizadas.
Valorable conocimientos de scripting en Python y experiencia en el desarrollo de ETLs con Python.




Te ofrecemos formar parte del equipo de profesionales de NTT DATA BPO , lo que significa que desde el primer día ponemos todos los mecanismos necesarios en funcionamiento para que tengas un plan de carrera y formación especializada para el desempeño de tus funciones profesionales:




Contrato Indefinido.
Plan de Carrera profesional en función de la formación, experiencia, potencial profesional y expectativas del candidato.
Formación desde el primer día dirigida a la especialización técnica y de transformación digital.
Salario en función de la experiencia del candidato.
Horario Lunes a Viernes en jornada flexible.
Modelo Híbrido.
Integrarte en una compañía multinacional líder (Una de las 10 compañías más grandes del sector a nivel mundial), joven y dinámica.
Formar parte de un ambiente creativo y colaborador donde puedes disfrutar de la experiencia del trabajo en equipo para lograr el máximo valor para nuestros clientes.
Trabajar en una empresa en constante evolución y crecimiento, realizando un trabajo enriquecedor con grandes oportunidades de desarrollo profesional.
Participación en proyectos innovadores y punteros para grandes clientes de primer nivel en distintos sectores de mercado.




Si eres una persona con buena comunicación, proactiva, que se sienta cómoda trabajando en equipo, no dudes en aplicar.

Title: Ice Cream: Customer Development Internship – Data Analysis and Report
Description:
The Ice Cream division at Unilever is preparing to stand on its own, aiming to become an independent, EUR 8.3 billion publicly listed company by the end of 2025. We’re on a mission to create the ultimate snacking company. A place where growth, innovation, founder and ownership mentality, and performance are cultivated and rewarded. And where we craft extraordinary ice cream experiences - transforming ordinary moments into lasting memories. Because we know, life tastes better with ice cream.

About The Magnum Ice Cream Company

The Magnum Ice Cream Company is all about growth. Growing our business. Growing our customers’ businesses. Growing our people’s careers. Growth begins with empowerment. So we free our people to be innovative, responsible entrepreneurs, driven and equipped to give our consumers more amazing products and unforgettable moments – and having fun doing it.   

With 19.000 expert ice cream colleagues and iconic brands like Wall’s, Cornetto and Ben & Jerry’s, loved in 76 countries, we are the world’s largest Ice Cream company leading the industry.  We have been taking pleasure seriously for more than 100 years, serving happiness with every lick or scoop of ice cream for generations.  

We are investing to unlock the full growth potential of The Magnum Ice Cream Company as a standalone entity, once we separate from Unilever, which is planned to happen before the end of 2025.  

We dream big but keep things simple to act fast.  

If you want to grow with us, make an impact, and shape the future of Ice Cream, this is the place for you! 

Job Purpose

As an intern in the Costumer Development Department, your ideas will drive impact, and your creativity will take center stage.

The team will provide you with opportunities to support projects that will help you develop and apply data analysis skills using tools like Excel, create customer analytics on sales performance, learn data manipulation and storytelling based on data, monitor and evaluate product performance, support marketing campaigns and innovations.

Key Responsibilities


Prepare sales data audits and analysis.
Create monthly performance reports.
Translate sales data into actionable insights.
Update and manage databases and reports.
Assist in retailer presentations and stakeholder engagement.
Conduct independent or team analyses.
Ensure data quality.


You Are The Perfect Fit If


You are available for 5 to 6 months starting 1st September 2025 (minimum 32 hours/week).
You are enrolled in a Bachelor (3rd or 4th year) or Master program with an analytical component.
You have experience with Power BI, Python, and/or R (a big plus).
You are fluent in English and Dutch.
You have strong analytical skills (Excel experience a plus).
You are curious, flexible, and data-savvy.
You have an affinity with commercial strategy


What You Can Expect


A unique mix of global scale & start-up spirit—€8.3bn powerhouse with an agile, entrepreneurial mindset. We’re building a new high growth Ice Cream company from the ground up.
A €625 gross/month allowance.
Travel reimbursement (if you don’t have a student travel card).
Career without limits—42 markets, international opportunities, and fast tracked growth.
A performance-driven culture—Freedom to act, disrupt and grow – your success is measured by impact.
A company that celebrates joy, innovation, and purpose—We create extraordinary careers, just like our ice cream creates extraordinary moments.


Additional Information

As publicly announced, Unilever will separate its Ice Cream business which is expected by the end of 2025. This role will transfer to the new Ice Cream company.

Unilever embraces diversity and encourages applicants from all walks of life. This means giving full and fair consideration to all applicants and continuing development of all employees regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership, and pregnancy and maternity. 

For the recruitment of this position, we would like to emphasize that local conditions apply to the position

ARE YOU EXCITED TO CRAFT THE ICE CREAM FUTURE?


Click "Apply now" and upload your CV and motivation letter. Don't forget to complete the questionnaire we send you. It's your chance to shine!
Our team will carefully review your application. We receive a lot of applications, so please bear with us as we give each one the attention it deserves.
If we think you might be a great fit, we'll schedule a friendly phone call to get to know you better and hear about your motivations.
We'll present your profile to the manager. If they’re impressed, you'll be invited for an interview to discuss the opportunity further.
After the interview, the manager will provide feedback on your performance. If you are selected, you'll receive an offer letter with all the exciting details about your internship.
Once you accept the offer, we'll guide you through the onboarding process, including any necessary paperwork, training sessions, and introductions to your awesome team.
You'll kick off your internship, get integrated into the team, and start working on your cool projects and responsibilities.


Disclaimer 

Equal Opportunity Employer: Unilever is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. 

We take pleasure seriously. Join the Ice Cream team now!
Show more
HTML:
The Ice Cream division at Unilever is preparing to stand on its own, aiming to become an independent, EUR 8.3 billion publicly listed company by the end of 2025. We’re on a mission to create the ultimate snacking company. A place where growth, innovation, founder and ownership mentality, and performance are cultivated and rewarded. And where we craft extraordinary ice cream experiences - transforming ordinary moments into lasting memories. Because we know, life tastes better with ice cream.

About The Magnum Ice Cream Company

The Magnum Ice Cream Company is all about growth. Growing our business. Growing our customers’ businesses. Growing our people’s careers. Growth begins with empowerment. So we free our people to be innovative, responsible entrepreneurs, driven and equipped to give our consumers more amazing products and unforgettable moments – and having fun doing it.   

With 19.000 expert ice cream colleagues and iconic brands like Wall’s, Cornetto and Ben & Jerry’s, loved in 76 countries, we are the world’s largest Ice Cream company leading the industry.  We have been taking pleasure seriously for more than 100 years, serving happiness with every lick or scoop of ice cream for generations.  

We are investing to unlock the full growth potential of The Magnum Ice Cream Company as a standalone entity, once we separate from Unilever, which is planned to happen before the end of 2025.  

We dream big but keep things simple to act fast.  

If you want to grow with us, make an impact, and shape the future of Ice Cream, this is the place for you! 

Job Purpose

As an intern in the Costumer Development Department, your ideas will drive impact, and your creativity will take center stage.

The team will provide you with opportunities to support projects that will help you develop and apply data analysis skills using tools like Excel, create customer analytics on sales performance, learn data manipulation and storytelling based on data, monitor and evaluate product performance, support marketing campaigns and innovations.

Key Responsibilities

  • Prepare sales data audits and analysis.
  • Create monthly performance reports.
  • Translate sales data into actionable insights.
  • Update and manage databases and reports.
  • Assist in retailer presentations and stakeholder engagement.
  • Conduct independent or team analyses.
  • Ensure data quality.

You Are The Perfect Fit If

  • You are available for 5 to 6 months starting 1st September 2025 (minimum 32 hours/week).
  • You are enrolled in a Bachelor (3rd or 4th year) or Master program with an analytical component.
  • You have experience with Power BI, Python, and/or R (a big plus).
  • You are fluent in English and Dutch.
  • You have strong analytical skills (Excel experience a plus).
  • You are curious, flexible, and data-savvy.
  • You have an affinity with commercial strategy

What You Can Expect

  • A unique mix of global scale & start-up spirit—€8.3bn powerhouse with an agile, entrepreneurial mindset. We’re building a new high growth Ice Cream company from the ground up.
  • A €625 gross/month allowance.
  • Travel reimbursement (if you don’t have a student travel card).
  • Career without limits—42 markets, international opportunities, and fast tracked growth.
  • A performance-driven culture—Freedom to act, disrupt and grow – your success is measured by impact.
  • A company that celebrates joy, innovation, and purpose—We create extraordinary careers, just like our ice cream creates extraordinary moments.

Additional Information

As publicly announced, Unilever will separate its Ice Cream business which is expected by the end of 2025. This role will transfer to the new Ice Cream company.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Scandit FINLAND




Imagine the what. Build the how.Scandit gives people superpowers. Whether enabling delivery drivers to make quicker deliveries, matching a patient with their medication, or allowing retailers to make store operations more efficient, our technology automates workflows. It provides actionable insights to help businesses in a variety of industries. Join us as we continue to expand, grow, innovate, and help take Scandit to the next level.




Your opportunity




As a Data Analyst in the Data Team, you will turn data into insights and support product managers, engineering teams, and other key stakeholders in decision-making based on data. You will also be heavily involved in the ShelfView product operations process as well as team internal reporting, KPI tracking, and data processing.





Analyse data and create visualizations in dashboards


Ingest, clean, and enhance static datasets like product catalogs


Drive on-off data handling needs and help to automate repetitive processes


Collaborate with other teams to turn data into knowledge and understanding





Who we look for





Degree in Data Analytics, Engineering, or a related field


2-3 years of work experience in Data Analysis.


Experience using Python to read, modify, and enhance data and use APIs to access production data


Curious mindset to explore hidden insights and work hands-on with data


Ability to start from a question and develop answers based on data


Familiarity with SQL queries, databases, and visualization tools (Looker Studio, PowerBI)


Excellent English communication skills, both written and oral


Eligible to work in Poland or Finland





The good stuffHere are just some of the reasons why people choose to build their careers at Scandit: 





An attractive individual equity plan in a high-growth company 


Smart, people-first culture


Flexible, office, hybrid, or home working


Innovation hackathons 


Team outings 


Festive/end of year all company celebrations 


Your birthday off 


Learning and development opportunities


Mentoring programs


Top-notch tech pack to enable you to do your most productive work


Brand new optimized-for-hybrid working HQ in Zurich as well as local offices in hotspots London, Tampere, Warsaw, Singapore and Tokyo


As well as specific benefits related to the location you are joining





 




We are proud to be “GREAT PLACE TO WORK” accredited in Switzerland, the UK, the USA, Poland, France and Italy and “GREAT PLACE TO WORK FOR WELLBEING” in the UK 




At Scandit we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be a safe space for all.




All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability or length of time spent unemployed. 




 




Imagine the What. Build the How.




“Everybody is welcome here” - Is a celebrated component of our DNA.




At Scandit we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be a safe space for all.




All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability, or length of time spent unemployed.




We help you capture every opportunity. www.scandit.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the chalenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.




DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:

DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;




DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;




DECSKILL CONNECT, through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.




Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.




We are looking for an Data Analyst!




Responsibilities:

To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends through what data can tell.
As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team.
Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understanding their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation).
You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analysing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic.
You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals.




Requirements:

Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields Experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI.
Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas).
Proficiency in SQL Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus.
Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus.
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus.
It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholder™s™ needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis.
Be driven, enthusiastic and dynamic in search of improving processes, controls & procedure.
Be pro-active, enthusiastic and able to work well in a team.
Fluency in English.




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference "CA/DataAnalyst".




Thank You.




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Chi siamo

🌟 La missione di Massima Energia è rendere semplice ciò che è difficile.

Stiamo rivoluzionando il mondo delle utility con una piattaforma all-in-one dedicata allo smart living: un ecosistema nativamente digitale che combina, in modo fluido e innovativo, energia elettrica e gas, mobile, internet, fibra e soluzioni per l'efficienza energetica — tutto a portata di mano, in un unico luogo.

💪 Esperienza senza paragoni.

Grazie al nostro approccio digitale ed alla costante attenzione verso il cliente, offriamo un'esperienza che unisce convenienza, efficienza e semplicità. I nostri clienti lo riconoscono: Trustpilot ci premia con un rating di 4.6/5.0!

🔬 Tecnologia che fa la differenza.

L’eccellenza si raggiunge con la continua innovazione. Con il lancio di MaxTech, il nostro laboratorio tecnologico dedicato a creare le soluzioni del futuro, puntiamo a un'esperienza cliente sempre più evoluta, grazie all’adozione pervasiva dell’Intelligenza Artificiale.


Descrizione del lavoro

Stiamo cercando una persona appassionata di digitale e progetti innovativi, da inserire nel nostro team come Data Analyst. La persona ideale, prima ancora delle competenze specifiche, possiede una spiccata attitudine imprenditoriale, è proattiva e motivata ad approfondire e sviluppare i progetti, con grande attenzione alla concretezza e alla collaborazione.


Il team di cui farai parte lavora su progetti innovativi che combinano l'analisi dei dati, l'intelligenza artificiale e il settore finance, creando soluzioni all'avanguardia per ottimizzare e trasformare i processi aziendali. Se sei appassionato di tecnologie emergenti e desideri contribuire a progetti che fanno la differenza, questa è l'opportunità che fa per te!


Cosa offriamo

  • Contratto di stage oppure contratto di assunzione a tempo indeterminato, commisurato dalla seniority del/della candidato/a;
  • Crescita professionale ed economica;
  • Occasione di fare la differenza;
  • Ambiente di lavoro giovane, informale e dinamico.


Attività

  • Effettuare analisi approfondite sui dati aziendali per identificare trend, anomalie e opportunità di miglioramento;
  • Creare e aggiornare report periodici, garantendo che siano efficaci nel fornire insight rilevanti e supportando le decisioni aziendali;
  • Utilizzare Excel in modo avanzato per analizzare, manipolare e visualizzare i dati, con la possibilità di utilizzare anche Power BI per la creazione di dashboard interattive e report dinamici;
  • Collaborare con i diversi team aziendali (es. Marketing, Sales, Operations) per comprendere le loro esigenze e fornire soluzioni basate sui dati;
  • Garantire il funzionamento e la correttezza della reportistica e dei processi del dato attraverso estrazioni ed elaborazioni sui database, utilizzando codice SQL;
  • Supportare il team nella gestione di progetti che coinvolgono l'intelligenza artificiale e la parte finance, con un focus su dati e analisi.


Competenze tecniche e caratteristiche personali richieste

  • Laurea Magistrale preferibilmente in Ingegneria, Statistica, Matematica, Fisica, Economia o discipline affini;
  • Approccio fortemente analitico e capacità di problem solving;
  • Ottime doti di comunicazione orale e scritta (anche in inglese);
  • Competenze avanzate in Excel (formule, pivot, macros, analisi avanzata dei dati);
  • Conoscenza di Power BI, preferibilmente per la creazione di report dinamici e dashboard interattive (è un plus);
  • Disponibilità, flessibilità e concretezza;
  • Capacità di portare risultati in un ambiente giovane e dinamico;
  • Forte spirito di team, proattività e propensione all’innovazione;
  • Forte spirito imprenditoriale e driver per il raggiungimento degli obiettivi.


Mindset

  • Avere spirito imprenditoriale, propositivo ed innovativo;
  • Portare a compimento i progetti prima del tempo previsto;
  • Più veloce è, più semplice è, meglio è;
  • Non concentrarsi sui problemi, ma sulle soluzioni;
  • Andare oltre le mansioni assegnate pur mostrandosi curiosi verso nuove attività;
  • Imparare velocemente;
  • Essere rigorosi ed equi con colleghi, partner e clienti.


Cosa offriamo

  • Ambiente inclusivo e dinamico: Lavorerai in un contesto in costante evoluzione, orientato alla crescita e alla collaborazione reciproca;
  • Percorsi di crescita e mentoring: Opportunità di avanzamento professionale e specializzazione in tecnologie avanzate. Potrai anche accedere a programmi di mentoring per sviluppare le tue competenze;
  • Collaborazione interfunzionale: Avrai l’opportunità di lavorare con diverse funzioni aziendali, acquisendo una visione completa del business;
  • Progetti innovativi e sfidanti: Contribuirai a progetti strategici che favoriscono lo sviluppo di nuove soluzioni e il miglioramento dei processi aziendali attraverso i dati;
  • Flessibilità: Lavoro in presenza a Milano, con 1 giorno a settimana di smart working;
  • Pacchetto retributivo competitivo: Offriamo una retribuzione commisurata all'esperienza e al ruolo.


Sede di lavoro

Milano (in presenza, 1 giorno alla settimana di flexible working).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Le Sporting de Charleroi recherche un(e) Stagiaire - Data Analyst pour le département Performance et Scouting.




Le Sporting de Charleroi est un club professionnel de football fondé en 1904 et évoluant en D1A. Club de tradition, le Sporting de Charleroi a des objectifs ambitieux de croissance commerciale et de résultats sportifs, et est également engagé dans la construction d’un nouveau stade dans la région de Charleroi.




Le club cherche un stagiaire pour une durée à déterminer (minimum 2 mois) afin de renforcer le département d’analyse de performances sportives et de scouting. Le stagiaire se concentrera principalement sur des tâches liées au recrutement de joueurs pour l’équipe première et les Zebra Élites (U23) ainsi qu’à l’amélioration des différents processus de reporting liés à l’équipe première. Le stagiaire sera sous la supervision directe du responsable du recrutement.




Intéressé(e)? Envoyez votre candidature (CV + lettre de motivation) à l’adresse suivante




datasperformances@sporting-charleroi.be




Profil

Maîtrise des langages de programmation R ou Python (obligatoire) : API, Visualisations, Reporting
Connaissance du football
Capacité d’adaptation au calendrier footballistique et contraintes horaires
High performer, orienté résultat et pragmatique
Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais
Autonomie, curiosité, proactivité et créativité.




Mission - Compétences & expertise requises

Développer des modèles et créer de nouveaux indicateurs clés de performance pour évaluer la performance des joueurs
Mener des recherches qui permettront d’améliorer et d’optimiser le processus de recrutement
Optimiser le reporting pre-match, live, et post-match de l’équipe première
Améliorer les processus de reporting individuel des joueurs de l’équipe première




Offre

Stage de minimum 2 mois dans un club professionnel de football (non-rémunéré)
Une opportunité de contribuer activement à la stratégie d’un club en plein développement
La possibilité de progresser au sein d’une organisation reconnue dans le milieu du football
Des outils modernes de scouting et d’analyse à votre disposition.

Show more

  • Stage de minimum 2 mois dans un club professionnel de football (non-rémunéré)
  • Une opportunité de contribuer activement à la stratégie d’un club en plein développement
  • La possibilité de progresser au sein d’une organisation reconnue dans le milieu du football
  • Des outils modernes de scouting et d’analyse à votre disposition.

Title: PERFORMANCE DATA ANALYST (F/M/D) | IGNITIS RENEWABLES
Description:
Do You want to be part of „Ignitis Group“?

We are currently looking for a new colleague to join the O&M & Asset Management Office of the Ignitis Renewables team, where you’ll be preparing monthly reports on operational asset performance, including the data extraction and processing, analysis and visualization. If that speaks to you, we’d be happy to welcome you to our team!

Take YOUR part in #EnergySmart! 

You will contribute to green and secure energy ecosystem creation by:



Ensuring accuracy, reliability, and completeness of performance data for your share of asset portfolio
Collecting and integrating data from automated systems and manual sources
Delivering regular performance insights
Managing and improving KPI dashboards
Conducting ad-hoc analysis to support internal stakeholder needs
Identifying key trends to support decisions on asset upgrades and service provider performance
Driving continuous improvement in processes and tools
Transforming data into action by generating insights that lead to practical decisions.



Required for this position:



Good understanding of statistical methods and ability to apply them to large datasets
Proficiency in data visualization and ability to present findings clearly and effectively
At least basic understanding of renewable energy systems
Fluency in English (minimum B1 level)
Ability to work independently and in a team
Advanced user of MS Office.



In return for creating a more sustainable future, we promise:



To take part in an unfolding energy transformation process to create a 100% green and secure energy ecosystem for both current and future generations
International team that is working on dynamic renewable energy projects
A hybrid work model (3+2) and flexible working hours
Extensive learning and qualification enhancement programs
Attention to physical and emotional health: wellness mentor initiatives and psychological support, etc.
Additional paid days for health improvement, short-term illness, volunteering, and accumulated work experience



Join a growing and increasingly international team of energy smart people united by a common purpose. We all play our part in creating a 100% green and secure energy ecosystem for current and future generations.

As we pursue our strategic goals to increase gender balance in Ignitis Group, we are indicating “f/m/d” next to job titles, meaning we welcome candidates of all genders – female, male or diverse.

Ignitis Group is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity and does not discriminate against race, religion, gender, sexual orientation or gender identity, age, disability or other personal traits unrelated to work obligations.

Salary range for this position group: is 2401 to 3602 EUR (before taxes). The final offer depends on experience and competence. Variable part of remuneration may be paid depending on results.

About us

Do you want to contribute to projects that are changing the future of green energy generation across the Baltics? Ignitis Renewables is a part of Ignitis Group – a renewables-focused integrated utility. Our purpose is to create a 100% green and secure energy ecosystem for current and future generations.

Ignitis Renewables focuses on developing green generation and green flexibility technologies. By developing onshore and offshore wind, solar, battery and power-to-X technologies, the company is implementing Ignitis Group’s strategic priority to deliver 4–5 GW of installed green capacities by 2030.

www.ignitisrenewables.com

Title: Data Analyst - Junior/Senior Level
Description:
🤔Who are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




🚀 Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

➡ Quantitative Finance

➡ Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

➡ Operations and Finance

➡ Transformation and Organization

➡ Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of €74.6 million.







🔎 We are looking for a Data Analyst - Junior and Senior Level




MAIN TASKS:

Analyze large volumes of data to help with business decisions.
Create dashboards and reports in Power BI to show results clearly.
Process, clean and transform data with Python, PySpark or Scala, especially in Big Data environments.
Building data pipelines (ETL) and preparing datasets for analysis.
Collaboration with technical and business teams to ensure data quality and consistency.
Supporting continuous improvement and data governance initiatives.
Automate processes to save time and avoid errors.




YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:

Experience in Power BI (modeling, DAX, visualizations).
Python skills applied to data analysis.
Knowledge of PySpark / Spark / Scala (valued in Big Data environments).
Solid knowledge of SQL.
Notions of data quality and governance.
Good communication skills (technical and non-technical).
Analytical mind and problem-solving orientation.
Proactivity and a sense of responsibility.
Proficiency in English (minimum B2).




📍Hybrid Role in Porto.




🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Your mission

As a Data Analyst Intern at Livo, you will work closely with Product and Business teams, your responsibilities will be:


Conduct analyses on customer usage, engagement, and feature effectiveness
Build dashboards and reports to monitor product performance and user behavior
Define and track Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for Product and Business initiatives
Present findings and recommendations clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders


Your profile


Currently finishing a degree in Data, Computer Science or a related field
Proactive mindset with a strong eagerness to learn in a fast-paced environment
Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g. Metabase, Tableau, Looker Studio, etc.)
Comfortable communicating data-driven insights clearly and collaborating with cross-functional teams
Bonus points for experience with Product or Web Analytics tools (e.g. Amplitude, Mixpanel, PostHog, etc.)


About Us

Livo was born with the mission to improve healthcare globally through cutting edge technology and that has always been our North Star since we deeply believe health is the most important asset we all have as individuals. We launched last year in Spain our nursing shift marketplace whose aim is to support health care institutions with their nurse staffing needs, by matching institutions with healthcare professionals that are interested in extra work, adding transparency, flexibility and convenience to both stakeholders and its traction has been outstanding. Our vision is to radically transform the way healthcare institutions hire, retain and manage talent nowadays whilst empowering healthcare staff with more tools, flexibility, money, and recognition.

Why us?

Title: Werkstudent Business Data Analyst
Description:
Werkstudent Business Data Analyst bei Knuddels GmbH & Co. KG

Anforderungen

Wohnsitz: Nur für Bewerber aus Deutschland

Sprache: Deutsch - Muttersprachliches Niveau


Du absolvierst gerade ein laufendes Studium der Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Mathematik oder eines vergleichbaren Studiengangs
Du besitzt sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL
Du besitzt mindestens gute Kenntnisse in Excel/Google Sheets und Python
Du verfügst über ein sehr gutes Zahlenverständnis
Du hast Freude am analytischen Denken
Du hast eine Leidenschaft für die Auswertung großer Datenmengen in Datenbanken und Google Sheets / Excel
Du hast idealerweise Vorkenntnisse in Java und kannst diese in deine Arbeit einbringen
Idealerweise hast du Kenntnisse im Testing und weißt schon was ein A/B-Test ist und wie man ihn auswertet


Tätigkeiten


Du erstellst Analysen aus vorhandenen Daten, die du vornehmlich mit SQL abfragst in Excel/ Google Sheets und Python
Du erstellst und trainierst Machine Learning Modelle
Du leitest Handlungsempfehlungen und strategische Entscheidungen zur Optimierung unseres Produkts auf Grundlage der gewonnenen Erkenntnisse ab und hast dabei auch immer im Blick, dass die benötigten Daten korrekt und vollständig vorliegen
Du berätst unsere Product Manager anhand deiner Analysen zur Vorbereitung von Tests und Features
Du verbesserst gegebenenfalls unseren nächtlichen Reload zum Datensammeln unter Einsatz von Java und SQL


Team

Wir sind ein tatkräftiges Team aus 56 Personen, darunter 25 Entwickler*innen. Wir haben ein sehr gutes Betriebsklima, unser Team besteht aus ganz vielen unterschiedlichen Charakteren (grob gesagt: Nerds und Nerd Compensators), die agil zusammenarbeiten und offen miteinander kommunizieren.

Über das Unternehmen

Seit 1999 bringt unsere Chat-Plattform Menschen näher zusammen

Mit mehr als 300.000 monatlich aktiven Mitgliedern in mehr als 1.000 aktiven Chaträumen sind wir Deutschlands größte Chat-Community. In einer schnelllebigen und stark umkämpften Branche können wir nur bestehen, weil uns Werte wie Offenheit, Vielfalt und Inklusion am Herzen liegen und wir ein klasse Team sind. Unser gemeinsames Ziel ist es, ein herausragendes Produkt zu schaffen, das unsere Mitglieder bewegt und begeistert.

Klicke auf "Bewerben" für Details zu den Benefits, dem Team und dem Bewerbungsprozess.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT US

We are a fast-growing, close-knit, dynamic, and successful Digital Services Company that specializes in providing support to large multinational companies for SEO, Product & Web Content Management, Social Media Management, Performance Marketing, E-Commerce Management, CRM & E-Mail Marketing Automation, DX & Development, Data Management & Analytics, Project Management, Digital Consultancy, and Recruitment.




As a multinational Dutch company, we have offices in Amsterdam, Istanbul, Lisbon, Kuala Lumpur & Portland. With our exceptionally talented & diverse team, and our A+ client portfolio, the world is our oyster!




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our global team!




RESPONSIBILITIES

Conduct detailed data analysis and develop actionable insights to support business decisions.
Create and maintain dashboards and reports to track key metrics and performance indicators.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and define business requirements for data solutions.
Extract, clean, and integrate data from multiple platforms including manual sources, APIs, and cloud data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake).
Support the development of upcoming web analytics dashboards, using tools such as Tableau and scripting in Python.
Perform data validation and quality checks to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Assist in the development of analytical models and visualizations to address business needs.
Provide support for data-related inquiries and troubleshoot issues as they arise.
Contribute to the development of self-service data tools and frameworks.
Participate in mentoring junior analysts and providing guidance on best practices.




QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree in economics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field; advanced degree is a plus.
2-5 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field.
Solid understanding of data analytics methodologies including data wrangling, visualization, and modeling.
Experience working with marketing and campaign data across platforms such as Google Analytics, LinkedIn, CRM systems (e.g., HubSpot, Salesforce), and AdOps platforms (e.g., YouTube, Google Marketing Platform).
Proficient in SQL, data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI), advanced Excel functions and comfortable working with cloud data platforms like BigQuery, Snowflake.
Working knowledge of programming languages such as Python or R.
Ability to handle manual data extraction and wrangling from varied sources.
Experience in a client-facing role is advantageous.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with effective communication abilities in English; additional languages are a plus.




WHAT WE OFFER

Remote Work Model💻: We continue to prioritize flexibility, boost productivity, and support a balanced work-life environment for our employees! To further strengthen our collaboration, we’re introducing one office day a month for our employees based in Lisbon. If you’re not located in or near a city with an NMQ office or co-working space, there’s no expectation to attend — but you’re always welcome whenever you’re in the area!

Meal Allowance🍔: We provide a meal card of €8,32 per workday.

Private Health Insurance🩺: We provide a private health insurance from MultiCare Card.

Birthday Time Off🎂: A half-day off is granted on birthdays.

Mental Health & Support💆🏻‍♀️: Free company subscription to our mental health & support partner ‘’Openup’’.

Referral Program👫🏻: Our referral program ‘’Friends2Work’’ encourages our employees to refer their friends followed by a cash award once they are hired.

Self-Improvement💪🏻: Access to numerous online courses and training in our own in-house training platform NMQ Academy & access to our exclusive Mentorship Program provided by our brilliant senior peers.

Team Environment👑: We give you to opportunity to work with global brands together with a fun, diverse, and dynamic team and become a part of a global success story!







If you are interested in joining our team, please apply with your CV in English.




By applying to this job advertisement, you accept that you have shared your personal data within the scope of the clarification text we have provided at www.nmqdigital.com




NMQ Digital is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.




Don't be discouraged if you feel that you don’t fully meet every single one of the requirements for a particular role, there is always room for growth in NMQ!

Title: Data Analyst, Controller
Description:
“Be the change you want to see in the world”, Mahatma Gandhi

Do you believe that taking care of each other is our main responsibility, that merely the intelligence of the heart can reveal human potential, and that taking small steps every day creates great achievements? If you are ready to go that extra mile with us and question the status quo of the beauty industry, then NAOS is the right workplace for you!




NAOS is one of the first independent skincare companies in the world. NAOS has created 3 brands inspired by ecobiology – BIODERMA, ESTHEDERM, and ETAT PUR. BIODERMA is one of the leading dermo-cosmetic brands in pharmacies in Hungary.

As our team is growing, we are looking for an energetic and dynamic person who is open to new challenges and would like to take the position of Business Data Analyst, Controller.




Our benefits:

Attractive remuneration based on experience
Performance-based bonus system
Being a part of a team with local, regional and international work and life experience
International communication opportunities and exchange
Development and further training
Additional private medical & life insurance
Cafeteria, private health & care service, employee shopping
Social events and annual teambuilding trip
Company laptop and mobile phone
Hybrid working policy & very good work-life balance




Key role responsibilities:

Collecting, coordinating, presenting, and analyzing data from sales, market, logistics, and financial areas to support data-driven decision-making
Ensuring the quality of source data in ERP, SFA, and BI systems
Developing data management processes and participating in development projects
Actively participating in the maintenance of master data
Contributing to monthly and annual closures and planning
Preparing reports and analyses using Excel and Power BI
Enhancing controlling reports and meeting new business reporting requirements
Supporting accounting




We expect to meet:

Minimum 2-3 years of relevant experience
Knowledge of enterprise resource planning systems
Professional knowledge of Excel (pivot tables)
User-level knowledge of Power BI, or other data management and analysis tools
Analytical, results-oriented mindset, systematic thinking, and problem-solving skills
Responsibility and ability to meet deadlines
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Proficiency in English
BA/MA in Economics




The advantages would be:

Knowledge of Power BI DAX, Power Query, SQL
Familiarity with SAP Business One or Business Central
Relevant industry experience
Financial accountant




The recruitment process includes: documents’ preselection -> personal interview with the selected candidate -> task -> final interview -> feedback.




Do you believe that taking care of each other is our main responsibility, that the intelligence of the heart can reveal human potential and taking small steps every day creates great achievements? If you are ready to go that extra mile with us and question the status quo of the beauty industry, then NAOS is the right workplace for you!

As our team is growing, we are looking for an energetic and dynamic person who is open to new challenges and would like to take the position of Business Data Analyst, Controller.


Our benefits:

  • Attractive remuneration based on experience
  • Performance-based bonus system
  • Being a part of a team with local, regional and international work and life experience
  • International communication opportunities and exchange
  • Development and further training
  • Additional private medical & life insurance
  • Cafeteria, private health & care service, employee shopping
  • Social events and annual teambuilding trip
  • Company laptop and mobile phone
  • Hybrid working policy & very good work-life balance


Key role responsibilities:

  • Collecting, coordinating, presenting, and analyzing data from sales, market, logistics, and financial areas to support data-driven decision-making
  • Ensuring the quality of source data in ERP, SFA, and BI systems
  • Developing data management processes and participating in development projects
  • Actively participating in the maintenance of master data
  • Contributing to monthly and annual closures and planning
  • Preparing reports and analyses using Excel and Power BI
  • Enhancing controlling reports and meeting new business reporting requirements
  • Supporting accounting


We expect to meet:

  • Minimum 2-3 years of relevant experience
  • Knowledge of enterprise resource planning systems
  • Professional knowledge of Excel (pivot tables)
  • User-level knowledge of Power BI, or other data management and analysis tools
  • Analytical, results-oriented mindset, systematic thinking, and problem-solving skills
  • Responsibility and ability to meet deadlines
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Proficiency in English
  • BA/MA in Economics


The advantages would be:

  • Knowledge of Power BI DAX, Power Query, SQL
  • Familiarity with SAP Business One or Business Central
  • Relevant industry experience
  • Financial accountant


The recruitment process includes: documents’ preselection -> personal interview with the selected candidate -> task -> final interview -> feedback.


Do you believe that taking care of each other is our main responsibility, that the intelligence of the heart can reveal human potential and taking small steps every day creates great achievements? If you are ready to go that extra mile with us and question the status quo of the beauty industry, then NAOS is the right workplace for you!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
QiBit, divisione ICT di Gi Group S.p.A., Agenzia per il Lavoro (Aut. Min. 26/11/04 Prot. n. 1101-SG), è specializzata nella selezione, formazione, inserimento e sviluppo professionale dei profili IT per il mercato italiano.

Il nostro obiettivo è generare valore e crescita professionale per le nostre Persone e garantire la sostenibilità nei progetti IT dei nostri Clienti e Partner tecnologici, presenti e attivi principalmente nei settori bancario, assicurativo, telecomunicazioni, utilities, e-commerce.




Per azienda cliente operante nel settore ICT ricerchiamo un/una:




JUNIOR DATA ANALYST




La risorsa contribuirà alla gestione, realizzazione ed implementazione di soluzioni di data management per il settore finanziario. In particolare, si occuperò di sviluppare, manutenere, testare e documentare soluzioni realizzate. Supporterà inoltre il cliente nell’utilizzo delle soluzioni realizzate e nel deployment delle stesse.




Requisiti:

· Laurea in materie Tecnico/Scientifiche o Economiche;

· Conoscenza di SQL e delle strutture dati;

· Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese

· Capacità analitiche, di teamworking ed orientamento al risultato.




Inquadramento: previsto inserimento in apprendistato




Sede di lavoro: TORINO




Facciamo parte di Gi Group Holding (www.gigroupholding.it) la prima multinazionale italiana del lavoro e una tra le principali realtà che offrono servizi e consulenza HR a livello globale. Il nostro Gruppo è attivo nei seguenti campi: Temporary, Permanent e Professional Staffing, Ricerca e Selezione di Profili Manageriali, Executive Search, Outsourcing, Formazione, Consulenza HR, Amministrazione HR, Employability, Transizione e Sviluppo di Carriera. Siamo presenti in più di 37 Paesi in Europa, Asia e America con un team di oltre 9.000 persone.

I valori che ci contraddistinguono: attenzione, collaborazione, passione, sostenibilità, apprendimento continuo e innovazione, responsabilità.

Consulta tutti i nostri annunci su www.gigroup.it




Gi Group S.p.A. è autorizzata ad operare dal Ministero del Lavoro e delle Politiche Sociali (Aut. Min. 26/11/2004 PROT. 1101 - SG).

L’offerta si intende rivolta ai candidati nel rispetto del D.lgs. n. 198/2006 e ss.mm.ii. e dei Decreti Legislativi n. 215 e n. 216 del 2003 sulle parità di trattamento.

I candidati sono invitati a leggere l’informativa privacy ai sensi degli artt. 13 e 14 del Reg. EU 679/2016 al seguente indirizzo www.gigroup.it/privacy-candidati

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Nielsen, we are passionate about our work to power a better media future for all people by providing powerful insights that drive client decisions and deliver extraordinary results. Our talented, global workforce is dedicated to capturing audience engagement with content - wherever and whenever it’s consumed. Together, we are proudly rooted in our deep legacy as we stand at the forefront of the media revolution. When you join Nielsen, you will join a dynamic team committed to excellence, perseverance, and the ambition to make an impact together. We champion you, because when you succeed, we do too. We enable your best to power our future.




About the position: (This is a Maternity Cover role - FTC 11 months )

Are you adept at problem-solving and able to provide a high level of service to colleagues and members? As a Panel Administrator you will be integral in fostering and maintaining high engagement and strong cooperation from Nielsen’s panel members in Denmark. 

The Data Analyst / Panel supporter maintains a close relationship with individual panel members as well as field technicians in order to ensure smooth and efficient data collection from the panel.




Responsibilities:
Provide clear and effective telephone and written support for both panel members and Nielsen field technicians
 Ensure that information in databases is accurate, valid and up to date
Ensure that data received from participating households adheres to quality control standards
Resolve problems by clarifying issues, researching and exploring answers and alternative solutions, implementing solutions, and escalating unresolved problems
Manage projects from start to finish (ideation/initiation to execution and evaluation), that can improve overall data quality and efficiency





Key Competencies:
University degree (preferably long-term higher education programme) within fields such as business administration, sociology, media studies
Able to speak Danish fluently.
Analytical skills and an ability to work with data in a structured manner
Able to drive continuous process improvements.A good understanding of media usage habits. 
Advanced knowledge of the ever-changing media landscape. 
Have a good sense for Tone of Voice when communicating with panel members
Able to speak and communicate in English

Nice to have :
General good IT skills (e.g. Google Sheets/Excel)
Adept at understanding and learning to use new IT systems and applications











Please be aware that job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by scammers seeking personal data or money. Nielsen recruiters will only contact you through official job boards, LinkedIn, or email with a nielsen.com domain. Be cautious of any outreach claiming to be from Nielsen via other messaging platforms or personal email addresses. Always verify that email communications come from an @nielsen.com address. If you're unsure about the authenticity of a job offer or communication, please contact Nielsen directly through our official website or verified social media channels.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst for one of our clients in the banking sector to support data-driven decision-making. The candidate will work closely with business units to gather, interpret, and translate data into insights that improve processes, support regulatory reporting, and inform strategic initiatives.







Responsibilities:




Collect, clean, and validate structured and unstructured data from internal and external sources.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualisations to support business analysis and performance monitoring.
Work closely with business stakeholders to define reporting needs and translate them into technical requirements.
Perform data mining and statistical analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Support regulatory and compliance reporting through accurate and timely data provision.
Collaborate with IT, risk, finance, and compliance teams to ensure alignment on data governance and quality standards.
Contribute to the development and documentation of data models and data dictionaries.
Assist in the implementation of data quality controls and data lineage tracking.







Profile:




Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Min 3 years of proven experience in a data analytics role, preferably within the banking or financial services sector.
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with data visualisation tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Qlik).
Experience with programming languages such as Python or R.
Solid understanding of data management principles, including data governance and data quality.
Experience working with large datasets and relational databases.
Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail.
Knowledge of banking products, financial regulations, or risk management is considered an asset.
Fluent in English and able to communicate professionally in Dutch.













About Dynafin Consulting




DynaFin Consulting is a human-sized, flexible consulting company delivering services in the Financial Services Industry. Our company consists of more than 160 committed consultants in several business domains: Invest – Payments – Credits – Insurance – Data - Risk & Compliance.

In 14 years, we have become a reference in the Belgian Financial Services landscape. In July 2017, we joined the Alan Allman Associates ecosystem, adding the international dimension to our ambitions.




What we offer :

- An attractive salary package (a competitive fixed salary with benefits: car (models in line with our "green fleet mobility" - net allowances - smartphone budget - full insurance & hospitalization insurances …).

- The opportunity to optimize your work-life balance.

- A team of dynamic and passionate colleagues, recognized for their expertise.

- An excellent collaborative working environment: One Team & One Dream
